Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world‚Äôs leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers‚Äô lives.

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Partnering directly with the finance, marketing, and product teams, your focus will be on deriving insights from the group data warehouse to produce both reporting capabilities and insights through to production.

What You Will Do


Utilize our technology stack (Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, and Superset) to derive insights from the group data warehouse.
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and actionable insights.
Build visualizations and storytelling frameworks to present data in an engaging and understandable manner.
Understand and analyze core e-commerce KPIs to support business objectives.
Ensure data stewardship and the delivery of accurate and reliable data analysis.



What You Should Bring


Mathematical, scientific, or engineering degree and one year of relevant experience or two-plus years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Experience in building visualizations and storytelling with data.
Understanding of Google Analytics 360.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.



Bonus Skills / If you know some of this, even better


Experience using Python, specifically creating Airflow DAGs.
Understanding of data warehousing best practices.
Some experience with or knowledge of source control (GIT).



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we have got you interested and you are open to taking the next step, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Berlin - up to ‚Ç¨90,000




We are working with a growing technology company in Berlin who are making multiple hires across their data team as it continues to expand, including a Data Analyst. If you are looking to join an organisation where you can make an instant impact and work across a range of projects, this could be a great opportunity for you.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular audits and quality checks
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to drive continuous improvement




Requirements:

Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Exposure to cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data modelling techniques




The role offers an excellent opportunity to develop and progress in your career, as the company continues on their upward trajectory. The team have also created an environment where people can constantly improve and develop their skill set, making it an enjoyable place to work.




The role is playing up to ‚Ç¨90,000 and offers hybrid working. Please reach out to find out more and apply!

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making and support the continuous improvement of our operations and services. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SQL, data modeling, and statistical analysis, with a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Independently analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights, framing problems correctly, cleaning, and interpreting data sets.
Structure complex analytical CTEs in modeling pipelines using advanced SQL techniques, including window functions.
Develop reliable and accurate analytical workflows using DBT to create analytics models.
Apply statistical and analytical methods confidently to generate insights on specific issues or domain problems.
Develop efficient tracking concepts, extend existing events and attributes, and proactively resolve tracking issues.
Manage the delivery of technical stories by collaborating with other teams and stakeholders, supporting data literacy initiatives.
Communicate findings clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, creating understandable summaries of reports.
Influence stakeholders by working on dashboards with company/department-wide impact, ensuring stakeholder engagement for realizing value.


ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for advanced data modeling, experience with DBT for creating analytics models, and familiarity with statistical analysis methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and propose relevant metrics.
Good understanding of the current domain or the ability to quickly acquire expertise and fluency in the domain.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Ability to work collaboratively within cross-functional teams, sharing knowledge and supporting junior team members.
Detailed knowledge of data sources within the immediate domain and support for data literacy initiatives within the company.


MORE THAN A JOB:

We are Blacklane, providers of premium global chauffeur services. Our mission is to create true peace of mind for discerning travellers by delivering perfect experiences around the world and to inspire a better future. Blacklane is offering airport transfers, City-to-City commutes, In-city mobility chauffeur hailing and Chauffeur-by-the-hour in over 50 countries globally, either pre-booked or on-demand. Whether it's for business or pleasure, Blacklane and its 300 employees and tens of thousands of chauffeur partners have the right premium transportation service for you. By changing how people move, we opened up new opportunities for our chauffeur providers and set industry standards for climate protection in the travel industry.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture:


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days.
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry-first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane plans to deliver 35% of global rides in EVs by year-end 2024, and 50% by the end of year 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Blacklane Cares day: Every crew member receives 8 hours of paid leave per year to participate in volunteering initiatives of their choice or lead employee-driven community outreach projects. Utilize your time to lend hands to a cause that drives your passion.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Team

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Revenue Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Sales initiatives. This role partners with Sales leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, and offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our Sales channel. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track sales performance and KPIs, from marketing spend to product activation, including metrics like estimated revenue and estimated lifetime value
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Sales leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Sales strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Sales, Finance and Revenue teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as small merchant segmentation and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


You‚Äôll be great for this role if you have:


2-4 years of years of analytical experience at a high-growth tech company in an Analytics/Corporate Strategy/Business Operations role or at a top management consulting firm with exposure to Sales/GTM assignments, including at least 1 year of professional work experience in data analytics and in data model design, preferably with experience in dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The capacity to examine Sales and GTM requirements and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, adept at finding trends and summarizing key insights from ambiguous data sets, coupled with effective communication skills and a strategic mindset, enabling seamless collaboration with GTM leadership
Highly analytical, the capacity to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to influence business outcomes


Why you should join SumUp:

üåç Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

üåà Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

üìö A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

üöÄ Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp‚Äôs future success

üí∂ A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

üîÑ 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

üîó Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

üöµüèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We‚Äôre the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) - FlixTrain
Description:
We're looking for a motivated and driven Data Analyst (m/f/d) for FlixTrain who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

If you get excited by pushing sustainable transport and being part of a dynamic and fast-growing startup within Flix, join us to build the largest private provider of long-distance rail transport!

Your Tasks ‚Äì Paint the world green


You will help FlixTrain‚Äôs management team make more data-driven decisions
You will be responsible for defining KPIs for various FlixTrain departments (focus: operations / production) and helping us critically assess the reasons behind our business performance through data analytics
As part of this, you are responsible for creating dashboards and reports in Power BI for FlixTrain‚Äôs departments
You will collaborate closely with different FlixTrain teams to understand their business problems and derive relevant data solutions to fit their needs
You will help us build scalable data models & transformations
You will collaborate with teams at Flix SE, such as the Operational Intelligence and Business Intelligence team, on our data models & transformations, as well as ensure FlixTrain specific data is available in our data warehouse


Your Profile ‚Äì Ready to hop on board


A degree from a top university in business, economics, statistics, or data science coupled with knowledge of and experience in statistics and data analysis. Alternatively, a degree in engineering and computer science from a top university coupled with an interest in solving business problems using data analysis
1-3 years of experience working in fast-paced and data-driven organizations
Advanced Excel skills, and first experience with SQL and data visualization tools such as PowerBI (experience with Snowflake is a plus)
Attention to detail, knowledge of best practices for checking and implementing data quality
Excellent analytical and critical thinkings skills
Ability to collaborate with business stakeholders, including the skill to communicate complex problems in simple terms
An interest and ideally a passion for the transportation sector or for operational business problems
Self-motivated and reliable
Team player with a problem-solving attitude
Proficiency in English
At least a basic knowledge of German


Optional


Experience with at least one advanced programming language (ideally Python or alternatively R)
Experience with data modelling, pipelines and basic data engineering


Our Perks ‚Äì More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We‚Äôre building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world ‚Äì and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Your Profile ‚Äì Ready to hop on board

Alternatively, a degree in engineering and computer science from a top university coupled with an interest in solving business problems using data analysis
  • 1-3 years of experience working in fast-paced and data-driven organizations
  • Advanced Excel skills, and first experience with SQL and data visualization tools such as PowerBI (experience with Snowflake is a plus)
  • Attention to detail, knowledge of best practices for checking and implementing data quality
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinkings skills
  • Ability to collaborate with business stakeholders, including the skill to communicate complex problems in simple terms
  • An interest and ideally a passion for the transportation sector or for operational business problems
  • Self-motivated and reliable
  • Team player with a problem-solving attitude
  • Proficiency in English
  • At least a basic knowledge of German

Optional

  • Experience with at least one advanced programming language (ideally Python or alternatively R)
  • Experience with data modelling, pipelines and basic data engineering

Our Perks ‚Äì More than just a job

  • You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
  • Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
  • Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
  • Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
  • We're not only green in color. We‚Äôre building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
  • Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

About Flix

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world ‚Äì and our journey has just begun.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from forecasting customers‚Äô lifetime value, optimise our bidding strategies in ad networks or measure the incrementality of our different marketing channels.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 80 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.


Who You Are


2-4 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Become a part of our success with virtual stock options
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.


Join Our Team: If you're ready to take your data analysis and market research skills to the next level in a dynamic and innovative environment, we want to hear from you! Apply now to become a key member of our team and help drive our success.

Title: Climate Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Job Description

This call for a Climate Data Analyst is part of our initiative to broaden our roster of experts specializing in regional climate modeling and data management. We are seeking distinguished professionals who are interested in contributing their expertise on a project basis and becoming integral to our future climate resilience initiatives. The role of the Climate Data Analyst focuses on supporting and enhancing our climate and energy systems modeling projects through rigorous data analysis and application of advanced analytical techniques.

Your Responsibilities


Design and manage databases specific to climate data, ensuring data integrity, quality control, and normalization
Handle large datasets and perform complex statistical analyses to support climate modeling and impact assessments
Utilize models to analyze current and future climate scenarios under various greenhouse gas emissions pathways
Support conducting risk and vulnerability assessments to understand potential impacts of climate change on various sectors such as agriculture, water resources, and urban planning
Proficiency in climate data analysis tools such as Python, R, GIS, and others relevant to data analysis and model simulation
Prepare detailed reports and scientific papers for publication in peer-reviewed journals
Document methodologies, data analysis procedures, and findings for stakeholders and policy recommendations
Communicate complex climate data and findings to a diverse audience, including technical and non-technical stakeholders to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Provide training and capacity building to project partners on climate data analysis, the use of climate modeling tools, and understanding climate risk assessments
Stay abreast of advancements in climate science and data analysis technologies. Innovate and propose new methods or tools to enhance climate analysis and modeling capabilities
Adapt methodologies and focus areas based on emerging climate issues and the evolving needs of regions or sectors being studied


Your profile

Education And Experience


A Master‚Äôs degree in Earth Sciences, Physics, Climate Science, Environmental Science, Data Science, or a related field; PhD preferred
A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in climate science research and data analysis or a related field
Demonstrated expertise in handling complex climate datasets
Proven track record of conducting high-level research and analysis in the areas of climate change
Experience working in or with developing countries on climate change issues is required
Strong understanding of IPCC outputs is required
A strong publication record in climate science, impacts and adaptation, preferably in developing countries


Skills


Expertise in statistical software and programming languages such as Python, R, and GIS applications
Strong skills in using machine learning tools and algorithms for predictive modeling and data analysis
Excellent ability to interpret complex data and translate findings into actionable recommendations
Strong communication skills for presenting data insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to engage and work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders
Fluency in English is required
Flexibility to work remotely, complying with company or governmental directives
A commitment to the organization's mission and core values, demonstrating integrity and ethical conduct in all professional dealings


Our offer


A job with purpose. With us you will work in a team of highly engaged people and with your skills you can make a positive contribution to our work in the field of climate change.
We are a diverse and inclusive team and welcome your application regardless of your gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect that makes you unique.
We are working in a positive and inspiring working atmosphere with an international team.


Conditions

Application Deadline: 05 July 2024

Starting date: As soon as possible

Location: Remote

For further information send your questions via email to procurement@climateanalytics.org.

Please apply with your CV in PDF format and share your expected daily rate exclusively using the application form by the deadline.

Applications by email or by post can unfortunately not be processed.

About Us

We are a global climate science and policy institute established in 2008 to bring cutting-edge analysis to bear on the most pressing issue of our time ‚Äì climate change. Our vibrant, international team is composed of 130 staff - half are based at our headquarters in Berlin, Germany, and the remainder work out of our five regional offices in Africa, Australia & Pacific, the Caribbean, South Asia and North America. Click here to find out more.

Title: Fullstack Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission

Others might refer to this unique role as a Business-oriented Data Engineer.

Are you passionate about diving deep into data, solving complex problems with clever logic, and working independently on robust data solutions? As a Fullstack Data Analyst, you will help bex gain a 360¬∞ view of activities and developments through data, creating the foundation for data-driven company management. You will be responsible for maintaining and further developing our existing data management and handling infrastructure, ensuring its continued reliability and effectiveness.

Your Responsibilities


Maintaining and gradually improving our existing data handling, reporting structures and management reports
Setting up governance for data quality, consistency, and trust in data handling
Keeping data pipelines healthy and adding new data sources to the Data Warehouse
Owning ETL processes for data from bexOS (our production system) and connected systems (support systems like Hubspot, finway or billomat)
Owning tool stack to handle data (esp. with Google Products like Cloud Scheduler, App Scripts, Cloud Functions, Big Query, ‚Ä¶), and setting up dynamic reports and dashboards (Google Looker Studio)
Adjusting dashboards as needed following data changes
Enabling teams to effectively use data via reporting tools in their daily work, empowering them to generate their own insights
Supporting business teams and product engineering squads in data handling, incl. providing use case and metrics-specific data sets
Managing defined KPI sets, ensuring data quality and providing documentation for such
Supporting the management team with plan/actual comparisons and the development of business cases
Gathering and structuring input and data related requests from business teams
Performing project based analysis tasks connected to company initiatives in collaboration with dedicated business teams, like operations, sales, marketing, finance or product management

Unique Aspects of the Role


You will be the sole member of the data team, which allows you to have a significant impact and take full ownership of the data infrastructure. Our plan is to staff the team over the period of 2 years with other positions.
You will closely collaborate with platform engineering and regular software developers, who focus on feature development.
You will report directly to and work closely with the VP of Platform, making this a unique position within the company.


Your profile

You are known for your cooperative and collaborative nature, always ensuring that coworkers are in the loop. You proactively seek to support and collaborate with others, not just when they are stuck, but also whenever they can lend a hand. With your humble nature and caring attitude, you foster trust and authenticity within the company.

Your ambition shines through in your constant pursuit of growth and understanding of the end results of your work. You are always open to feedback, eager to innovate, and actively share knowledge with the team.

You are straightforward in your approach, by being transparent and honest. Not only that, but you make decisions confidently, follow up diligently, and are authentic and proactive in your interactions. Furthermore, you are not afraid to address any tensions or issues directly, and take the lead in and responsibility for your actions.

Your curiosity is evident in your approach to unknowns and complexities. You see these as opportunities for growth and improvement. Your curiosity often leads you to new, innovative solutions.

Your Profile


"Getting it done" mentality, and strong communication skills
Demonstrated willingness to learn and grow
Analytical understanding and general curiosity in business performance and technical data handling
Experience with analytics, reporting, and dashboard tools, especially Google products (Google App Scripts, Google Cloud Functions, Google Looker studio, BigQuery, Looker Studio)
Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and prior work experience in connecting it via LowCode Tools like Zapier or other Google Products to facilitate simple data gathering use cases
Experience in using AI Assistance like ChatGPT or Copilot to enhance effectivity
Fluent in English, German is a plus


Technical Skills (summary)


SQL writing queries combining several datasets
Proficiency in Excel (beyond VLOOKUP)
Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and first experience in Google App Scripts
First experience with Python Code to write and manage data ETL processes
First working experience with
Google Cloud (Cloud Scheduler, Secret Manager, Cloud Functions)
Google Looker Studio
BigQuery
Low-Code tools such as Zapier

Why us?


Virtual shares in the company
Home-Office First policy, with no mandatory office presence
Entrepreneurial position with responsibility and independence
Top-notch IT equipment of your choice and work with modern tools
Time for learning and development leaves and/or trainings
Comprehensive onboarding phase and regular feedback
Open, positive entrepreneurial and team culture without egos and politics
Direct collaboration with the experienced and well-coordinated management and leadership team


About Us

bex is a digital logistics platform for the construction industry. Do you want to be part of a dynamic company that is becoming the new standard for last-mile in construction and logistics? Then come join us!

Our Company Values

Cooperative working - We work in collaboration and support each other.

Ambitious growing - We are hungry for growth and want to develop continuously.

Optimistic thinking - We focus on the solution and not on the problem.

Straightforward acting - We act and communicate directly, clearly and constructively.

At bex technologies, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for every person who works here or with us, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, size, socio-economic status, origin, age, culture, faith or religion (or lack thereof).
Show more

Your curiosity is evident in your approach to unknowns and complexities. You see these as opportunities for growth and improvement. Your curiosity often leads you to new, innovative solutions.

Your Profile

  • "Getting it done" mentality, and strong communication skills
  • Demonstrated willingness to learn and grow
  • Analytical understanding and general curiosity in business performance and technical data handling
  • Experience with analytics, reporting, and dashboard tools, especially Google products (Google App Scripts, Google Cloud Functions, Google Looker studio, BigQuery, Looker Studio)
  • Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and prior work experience in connecting it via LowCode Tools like Zapier or other Google Products to facilitate simple data gathering use cases
  • Experience in using AI Assistance like ChatGPT or Copilot to enhance effectivity
  • Fluent in English, German is a plus

Technical Skills (summary)

  • SQL writing queries combining several datasets
  • Proficiency in Excel (beyond VLOOKUP)
  • Proficiency in G-Suite Sheets and first experience in Google App Scripts
  • First experience with Python Code to write and manage data ETL processes
  • First working experience with
    • Google Cloud (Cloud Scheduler, Secret Manager, Cloud Functions)
    • Google Looker Studio
    • BigQuery
    • Low-Code tools such as Zapier
Why us?

  • Virtual shares in the company
  • Home-Office First policy, with no mandatory office presence
  • Entrepreneurial position with responsibility and independence
  • Top-notch IT equipment of your choice and work with modern tools
  • Time for learning and development leaves and/or trainings
  • Comprehensive onboarding phase and regular feedback
  • Open, positive entrepreneurial and team culture without egos and politics
  • Direct collaboration with the experienced and well-coordinated management and leadership team

About Us

bex is a digital logistics platform for the construction industry. Do you want to be part of a dynamic company that is becoming the new standard for last-mile in construction and logistics? Then come join us!

Our Company Values

Cooperative working - We work in collaboration and support each other.

Ambitious growing - We are hungry for growth and want to develop continuously.

Optimistic thinking - We focus on the solution and not on the problem.

Straightforward acting - We act and communicate directly, clearly and constructively.

At bex technologies, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for every person who works here or with us, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, size, socio-economic status, origin, age, culture, faith or religion (or lack thereof).

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data and love uncovering meaningful insights? Futurae, a leading Swiss cybersecurity company, is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic and agile team. As a Senior Data Analyst at Futurae, you will play a critical role in designing, building, and improving our internal and customer-facing dashboards and tools for data analysis. Your work will contribute to providing valuable business insights to both internal stakeholders and our customers. Join us and be part of shaping the future of cybersecurity while creating outstanding user experiences!

About Us

Futurae is a customer-centric cybersecurity company that focuses on providing seamless authentication and transaction confirmation solutions. Our innovative approach prioritizes security and usability, empowering businesses to combat online threats effectively. With our experienced and diverse team of industry leaders, we constantly strive to solve the toughest challenges in online authentication and transaction signing. Join our young, international, and fast-paced team and play a significant role in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Learn more about us at www.futurae.com.

What You'll Do


Design, build, and optimize internal and customer-facing dashboards and tools for data analysis
Analyze data to uncover meaningful insights and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with product management and technical architects to define feature specifications
Partner with product, research/design and marketing teams to define A/B testing hypotheses, success metrics, and ensure statistically sound test design
Analyze and interpret results to inform product roadmap and marketing optimization
Participate in the development cycle of our software product and follow Agile development practices
Write high-quality, maintainable code in languages such as Python, R, or SQL



Requirements


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably in a cybersecurity or technology-related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for uncovering insights from complex datasets
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Metabase or Tableau
Experience with statistical analysis techniques and familiarity with machine learning concepts
Solid programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or SQL
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex information
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Understanding of data security measures and privacy regulations in relevant industries


If you are a self-driven and detail-oriented individual who loves working with data and enjoys finding insights that drive business decisions, we would love to hear from you. Join Futurae and contribute to making a significant impact on the future of cybersecurity!

Benefits

Why Futurae

Join a young, international, and fast-paced Cybersecurity company with experienced industry leaders


Futurae Stock Options
Yearly personal learning & development budget
Apple Laptop and equipment for work purposes
Ability to work remotely (European time zones only)
Work at the forefront of an inspiring, dynamic tech company in the B2B space in the area of end-user authentication and transaction confirmation
Be part of our friendly, knowledge-sharing, entrepreneurial culture and flat hierarchy, where we value open and respectful communication, collaboration and an attitude that gets things done for our customers
Work in a role that gives you responsibility and independence
Access to coaching, ongoing professional development and training, mentorship and our culture of continuous learning


Futurae is an Equal Opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

By sending your application, you allow Futurae to handle and store your data.

Title: People Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Back to list People Data Analyst (f/m/d)Your role

As a People Data Analyst at Forto, you will be at the forefront of transforming our People function through data-driven insights and strategic analysis. In this key role, you will collect, analyze, and interpret data related to key metrics such as employee recruitment, engagement, performance, and retention. You will engage with dynamic cross-functional teams, and work closely with colleagues across both Asia and Europe to implement effective people strategies that support our business objectives. Your work will directly influence strategic decision-making and help shape the future of our organization.

You will


Collect, manage, and analyze all employment-related data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to employee demographics, performance, engagement, retention, and other key metrics;
Develop and maintain people metrics for regular reporting and ad hoc analysis, presenting findings to key stakeholders across the company;
Provide data-driven insights to assist in workforce planning, productivity measures, and performance/talent management programs;
Support all people-related projects and processes by leveraging comprehensive data analysis;
Collaborate closely with Finance, People Business Partners, People Operations, and Forto‚Äôs People Leadership to ensure alignment and integration of people analytics with broader business strategies;
Lead and support People analytics projects, ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of insights;
Monitor and evaluate the impact of implemented People initiatives and strategies, making recommendations for improvements based on data-driven insights;
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in People analytics and data management to continually enhance the effectiveness of people analytics at Forto.



What you bring


3 to 5 years of experience in People analytics, preferably in a fast-paced, growth-oriented company;
Strong analytical skills with hands-on experience in People data management;
Proven ability to translate data and trends into actionable recommendations for internal stakeholders;
Exceptional stakeholder management and relationship-building skills;
Strong communication skills, both written and oral;
Ability to advise and collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders across an organization with 40+ nationalities in Europe and Asia;
A proactive, can-do attitude with a builder mentality;
Comfortable taking ownership of projects and driving them from inception to completion.



Forto Is An Internationally Growing Company


Company language: English
17+ offices across Europe & Asia
800+ employees
30+ nationalities represented
2500+ customers



Read more about us

Team:


At our core, we are in love with progress and cannot cope with the standstill.
We are constantly striving for ways to be even better tomorrow. We are facilitators, we are explorers, we are visionaries.
Forto provides a sense of belonging, where everyone has equal access to opportunities, career advancement and recognition. It stands for a workplace where people from all walks of life, with diverse perspectives and experiences can do their best work, while being their authentic selves. That‚Äôs why we encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ages, races, religions, and abilities to apply for our opportunities!



Work Life:


Experience a company culture where we work on eye level and knowledge sharing, as well as mentoring is on our daily agenda.
We love our work and tackling business challenges but also believe in the importance of having a healthy balance with our personal life. That's why we appreciate a flexible work setup that fits around family, friends, and physical health.
We have the freedom to work in a hybrid setup.



Company Offering:


Sustainability Team
Emission Offsetting
Green Energy
Organic Food
Paperless Office
Inspiring Office Spaces
Flexible Working Hours
Team & Company Events
Hybrid Work
Peer Learning Program
Mentorship Program
Leadership Training
L&D Budget
Best Onboarding Program
Visa & Relocation Support
Remote Onboarding
Buddy Program

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have strong background in Data Analysis?




Do you want to apply your skills and grow within a growing market?




We've partnered with a leading supplier of modern and professional learning solutions.




You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.




Please apply if you have the following:

A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
You can record, analyze, develop solutions and master various tools for data analysis and visualization such as Mixpanel or Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills with storytelling and visualization techniques to prepare findings in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
Ideally, you have knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
You have experience with cloud-based data platforms.
You have experience in sales processes and automation and data structures (ideally in Salesforce).
You have experience in an agile environment
6+ years industry experience




Nice to have:

Good communication skills in German and English




This is an urgent position. If the above stands out to you and you feel you are right for the role, please do send in your application/ get in touch with a member of the Big Cloud team as soon as possible. Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we‚Äôre only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Title: Staff Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company‚Äôs financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, ‚Ä¶).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.

Title: Environmental Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Berlin

Your tasks


Responsible for energy and water data collection and processing (Data handling towards ESG/Non-Financial Reporting)
Support in analyzing and implementing digital solutions and procedures for data collection and reporting
Train operations/other departments on new processes and tools for data collection
Coordinate with multiple departments and manage incoming energy data from all sources
Checking for completeness and performing quality checks of incoming energy data
Helping develop reports and analysis
Implementation of reporting standards (e.g., CSRD, EU taxonomy)



Your profile


A completed education in the fields of engineering, energy, environmental or economic sciences (masters)
Good analytical skills, self-starter and self-motivated
Strong MS Excel skills and good MS office knowledge
Experience with environmental data management tools would be beneficial
Previous knowledge about CSRD, EPRA, GRI and CDP reporting standards would be good
Good communication skills in both English and German



Your perspective


Interesting, varied and broad range of tasks in one of the largest real estate companies in Germany and Europe
Good atmosphere, communication culture "on a first-name basis" and a pleasant working atmosphere in an environment with flat hierarchies
Individual training for professional and personal development in our academy
Professionally equipped, in-house gym with trainers and classes
Comprehensive company health management and company pension scheme
Assistance on the commute through subsidy for the use of public transport
Modern IT equipment such as laptops and mobile phones
Mobility and flexibility using pool and company cars for the execution of tasks
Flexible working hours and mobile working for an even better work-life balance
Exciting virtual programs for childcare with our partner company Voiio Opportunity to attend Bundesliga matches of FC Union Berlin, our favorite club
Discounts at selected hotels worldwide with up to 30% on overnight stays and special conditions on food and beverages
Employee discounts for special conditions in the areas of media, fashion, leisure, facilities and much more via a partner company
Drinks and a selection of fruits



Have we awakened your interest?

Then click on "Apply now" below and Maryam Al-Dolaimy will be happy to receive your detailed application documents, stating your earliest possible starting date and your salary expectations.

Aroundtown, Personalabteilung, Wittestra√üe 30, Haus F, 13509 Berlin

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
We need people on the ground in Germany to evaluate and validate mapping data like locations, business names, opening hours, distances for navigation and more!




A high level of accuracy is required for this role as your analysis will have real world impact on mapping data shown to millions of people around the world.




Over time, successful candidates will be presented with new learning opportunities to develop their skills and progress on to more varied and intricate projects.




This is a part time (max 20hrs) highly flexible role where you‚Äôll set your own hours and work to your own schedule.




Basic Requirements

Fluent in German and English
Living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Willing to work a minimum of 10 hours per week (pending project availability)
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
A passing grade in an online open-book assessment provided by us.




Benefits

Fully flexible working
Competitive rate of hourly pay
Learning resources provided for the assessment
Develop and apply your research skills in a real world environment

We need people on the ground in Germany to evaluate and validate mapping data like locations, business names, opening hours, distances for navigation and more!

Over time, successful candidates will be presented with new learning opportunities to develop their skills and progress on to more varied and intricate projects.

Title: Remote Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a meticulous Remote Data Integrity Analyst to ensure the accuracy and reliability of our data entries into company databases and CRM systems. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to data integrity.

Responsibilities:


Verify and correct data entries for accuracy and completeness.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data integrity.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly.
Perform regular data backups and digital filing.
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.


Qualifications:


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in data management is a plus.
Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace.
Familiarity with data entry software and tools.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.


Benefits:


Competitive hourly wage.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work from the comfort of your home.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office


LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.
