Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company‚Äôs performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You‚Äôll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Senior Data Scientist at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, developing and applying data science models to solve real world problems in the mobility sector. You will work closely alongside our Product & Engineering teams and build revenue-generating and cost-saving data products. As part of your role, you will interact with a wide range of business stakeholders from different countries. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Lead the development and end to end implementation of machine learning models (e.g. demand forecasting, pricing optimization, customer lifetime value and churn prediction models)
Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.
Serve as a trusted expert in data science and ML, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data team.




ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in modeling business problems using machine learning techniques (incl. feature engineering, choice of model, implementation and evaluation)
You have demonstrated the ability to manage and/or mentor less experienced team members by sharing your data science knowledge
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
You continuously learn, you are a critical thinker and creative problem solver.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.


MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs' 'empty leg' journeys and have grown with our partners to over ‚Ç¨100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we're now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we've successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew! We are now poised for massive growth in 2021.


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer - Energy Tech (w/m/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? Yes, at Green Fusion!

With our software for optimized control of heating systems in the real estate industry, we are combating climate change. Through digitalization and automation of control processes, we can not only reduce emissions but also energy consumption, thus actively driving the energy transition.

As a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, you support the Research & Development Team in keeping our promise to customers: to save 20% energy and reduce CO2 emissions in their buildings. With us, you have the opportunity to take on a job with real impact by developing algorithms, analyzing datasets, and advancing the optimization of our buildings.

Tasks


You will be responsible for developing production-ready algorithms and data pipelines that optimize energy system components, helping our customers to reduce their CO2 emissions and maximize energy efficiency in their buildings.
You will be working in cross-functional teams, consisting of energy automation engineers and software developers, to create new features for our smart home energy management system.
Additionally, you will be supporting our research team by conducting experimental data analysis to gain new insights and improve/invent energy optimization algorithms.
Together with you, we see this role developing in Data Science/ Machine Learning/ Data Engineering, depending on your interest and the development of our team.


Requirements


You have a minimum of three years of professional experience in data analysis.
You have comprehensive knowledge of Python and Git, as well as proficiency in SQL, GraphQL, and REST.
Additionally, you demonstrate proficiency in data science libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, and SciKit-Learn, and have experience working with time series data and a strong understanding of object-oriented programming.
Effective communication skills are critical for success in this position. You communicate effectively with various stakeholders, guide discussions, and foster a collaborative work environment.
You show proactiveness, have a strong desire to learn, and are interested in technical contexts.
You are fluent in English and have basic knowledge of the German language.


Benefits

üè†We provide flexibility in working hours and remote work options - even after the pandemic you can continue working from home.

üí°We believe in continuous learning and provide opportunities for personal and professional growth through job challenges, open feedback culture, and training budget for employees.

üå± With us, you can have a direct impact through your job by contributing to the fight against climate change and actively advancing the energy transition every day.

üíö We value our team and organize regular team events, workation with the team, or regular exchanges spaces to foster a positive work environment.

üíºWe offer employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.

üôå Finally, we are proud of our talented and purpose-driven team in Berlin and believe it's one of the best in the city. If you're interested, apply now and see for yourself!

While we are still pioneers today, with you, we can soon dominate the market! First in the DACH region, then across Europe.

You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and vibrant environment that passionately and ambitiously wants to actively shape the energy transition - and this can only succeed together!

We look forward to receiving your application - Fernanda will get in touch with you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
APCOA is Europe's leading parking operator with more than 50 years of industry expertise. With its 5,000 employees, the Group manages more than 1.8 million individual parking spaces at 13,000 locations in 13 European countries. The company is active in the areas of parking, charging, technologies, and urban solutions. With its consistent ‚Äúasset light‚Äù business model, APCOA is the trusted partner who maximizes value for private and public real estate owners.




Via its open digital platform, APCOA FLOW, the company connects on-street and off-streetcar parks with owners, partners, customers and their vehicles. Based on this technology, APCOA is transforming its car parks into urban hubs, creating the physical and digital infrastructure for mobility, logistics, EV charging and a wide range of innovative services that enable a more convenient mobility experience.




The environment also benefits: With its digital services and intelligent Traffic Management System, the company actively contributes to the reduction of emissions in cities by decreasing the volume of logistics traffic and vehicles searching for parking. By connecting parking, mobility, and proximity services for urban living, APCOA is positioned to become an integral part of the digital and physical Smart City ecosystem.




To strengthen the team in Berlin, we are looking for an:




Senior Data Analyst (all genders)




Responsibilities:

Develop and define comprehensive tracking specifications, data models, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to evaluate our product and engineering strategies effectively.
Design and create dashboards that showcase product performance for the organization and teams.
Collaborate with Product Management to convert business requirements into robust data models and actionable insights.
Perform complex data analyses to detect trends and patterns, providing actionable insights to enhance product and operational performance.
Lead ad hoc analyses to inform strategic decisions across product, operations, and business spheres.
Collaborates closely with Data Engineers to ensure optimal data pipeline architecture for advanced analytics, reporting, and data-driven decision-making.
Help us become a data-driven organization and offer expert advice on qualitative analysis and experimental design.
Establish and define data analysis processes. You‚Äôll be the first person to join this team, so you will have the opportunity to shape the data analytics unit.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Senior Data Analyst in a data driven organization.
Demonstrated experience in utilizing data build tool for transforming data in the warehouse and preparing it for analysis.
Expertise in database management and querying with both SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra) technologies, as well as proficiency in programming with R, Python, or similar data analysis languages.
Experience creating dashboards with CleverTap, Metabase or similar analytics tools.
Extensive practical experience in documenting data models and tracking specifications.
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Independent work ethic with a proven track record of initiative and successful project completion.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Leadership experience or potential with the capability to mentor future team members.
Deep understanding of analytics and data sciences.




Our Offer to you:

Mission driven and customer-centric company and tech organization, with strong focus on people and their professional growth.
Opportunity to impact positively millions of people using our products every day.
Varied tasks and challenges with a great deal of creative freedom
Room for creativity in your work and the chance to actively contribute to the success of the company.
Flat hierarchies, direct communication channels and a very good and open team atmosphere in an intercultural environment
An attractive workplace with very good public transport connections
The possibility to also work from home.
Attractive and performance-oriented salary packages
International cooperation with colleagues and business partners throughout Europe

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
remote - Germany, Spain, Czech Republic, Portugal, Slovakia or Austria | Full-time | Start ASAP

About us üöÄ

We accelerate the growth of digital companies by providing tailored funding solutions and data-driven financial insights. Our mission is to refine capital for economies to come. We want to enable every company to access funding that'll help them to thrive.

As a product- and tech-driven company we are founded by a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs. We are backed by Tier 1 venture capital investors that have also backed the likes of Stripe, Trade Republic, Telegram, Monday.com and Sorare.

Our values üí™üèº

We value flat hierarchies, full ownership and responsibility. Trust and open, honest communication are crucial to us, as it makes everything else easier. We work together and grow as a team.

Focus on Execution: We love and live off great ideas, but to create value we need to focus on execution.

Don't Fear Failure: We know that failure is an innate part of learning and success, so we value these experiences and take them as opportunities to try again and get better.

Trust Your Team: We trust our peers to do their best to achieve our shared goals, support each other and share their feedback so we can all grow and develop.

Your contribution to our success ü§ì


You will write production-grade Python code for data applications that will be directly integrated into re:cap's platform
You will collaborate with our backend team (working mostly with Go) to ensure our solutions are successfully implemented from end-to-end
You will interface with different teams to gather business requirements and prototype solutions (e.g., Streamlit applications or Python scripts)
You will build pipelines to move data from various third-party sources into re:cap's data warehouse in Google BigQuery
You will maintain our data warehouse and ensure our data transformations are efficient and well structured using dbt and SQL


Who we are looking for üïµüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è


You are quick to iterate on your solutions
Your attention to detail ensures that the data you provide supports critical business decisions accurately
You're comfortable wearing multiple hats, from supporting the finance department with data analysis to building data pipelines and deploying data applications
You can effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences and translate their requirements into code
Experience with tech-driven and distributed companies is a plus
You have a valid EU work permit and reside within the EU. re:cap does not offer visa or relocation support at the moment


Our tech stack üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª


Programming languages: Python, SQL and Go
Data ingestion: Airbyte
Data transformation: dbt
Data warehouse: Google BigQuery
Orchestration: Dagster
Analysis & reporting: Looker Studio, Streamlit
DevOps: AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, GitHub
Experience with our stack isn't a must


What you can expect ü™¥


Remote first. Our team is located all over Germany and Europe, with the flexibility of 100% home office. However, if you are in Berlin you are more than welcome to come around the office and maybe even bring your furry friend üê∂
Stock options. Every employee receives stocks, because our success is also your success
Development opportunities. Because we care about your growth, we have regular feedback talks as well as set paths for the development of each employee
The latest tech equipment. Every new team member receives an Apple MacBook Air to guarantee smooth productivity
Flexibility. We offer flexible working hours and value asynchronous communication as well. On top we offer 25 vacation days
Team building. Meet the team at in-person on-sites, get a buddy to fully integrate into the company and join other team events
International travel health insurance. Prioritizing your well-being with comprehensive coverage, we guarantee your peace of mind wherever your travels take you
Workation. Experience the blend of work and leisure with our worldwide new benefit catering to your work-away-from-home needs
We care about security. You will receive 1password family membership
Choice. You get a monthly budget to finance a benefit of your choice


Even if not all of these points fit 100% we encourage you to apply! We hire also for attitude, not just for knowledge and are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

What comes after you apply? üßöüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Easy steps for a smooth hiring process


Application Review
Get to know re:cap
Case study/Take home Assignment (depending on the position)
Role-specific Interview
Get to know the team
Offer


We are committed to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace where we provide equal opportunities regardless of age, gender identity, disability status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion. Therefore we encourage you to apply as all qualified applications will be taken into consideration.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Stellenbeschreibung

Du willst die digitale Zukunft von Bund, L√§ndern und Kommunen mitgestalten? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir bei CGI arbeiten in gemischten Teams aus erfahrenen Mitarbeiter:innen und Berufseinsteiger:innen in agilen Projekten an der Entwicklung von L√∂sungen f√ºr die digitale Transformation Deutschlands. Bei all unseren Projekten haben wir immer das gleiche Ziel: Wir wollen unseren Kunden helfen das Leben f√ºr B√ºrger:innen und √∂ffentlich Bedienstete einfacher zu machen. Das m√∂chtest du auch? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung als Data Engineer (m/f/d) an unseren Standorten Berlin, K√∂ln oder D√ºsseldorf.

Aufgaben

Das erwartet dich bei uns

Als Data Engineer (m/f/d) bist du unsere erste Wahl, wenn es um die Anbindung, Aufbereitung und Bereitstellung von

Daten im Kontext Analytics und BI geht. In Projekten unterst√ºtzt du als Teil der Data Intelligence-Einheit unsere Kunden

aus dem Public Sector bei den folgenden Aufgaben:


Design und Implementierung von Data Pipelines
Automation, Tuning und Betrieb von bestehenden Data Pipelines
Analyse und Bereinigung von Data Quality Issues
Betrieb und Optimierung eines hochverf√ºgbaren SQL-Clusters
Entwicklung performanter Datenmodelle
Beratung bei der Auswahl der richtigen Technologien
Begleitung von Proof of Concepts ‚Äì Neugier, Vielseitigkeit und Enthusiasmus sind hier eine gro√üe Hilfe


Qualifikation


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Computer Science, Data Science oder eine


vergleichbare Ausbildung


Praktische Berufserfahrung im Kontext Data Pipelines als Softwareengineer, Softwareentwickler, Data


Engineer oder √§hnlichem Berufsfeld


Fundierte Erfahrungen in Datenmodellierung und Datenbankadministration insbesondere in SQL (z.B. in


MS SQL)


Gute Kenntnisse im Linux-Umfeld und/oder Windows-Umfeld
Vertrautheit mit Container¬¨ Plattformen (z. B. Docker) und Werkzeugen im Kontext CI/CD (z.B. Git,


Jenkins)


Von Vorteil sind gute Kenntnisse in einer objektorientierten Programmiersprache wie Java oder C#


und/oder Python oder R


Deutschkenntnisse auf C1 Level


Was wir bieten


Ein Team mit dem die Zusammenarbeit Spa√ü macht. Wir begegnen uns offen, duzen uns √ºber alle Positionen hinweg und denken nicht in Hierarchien oder Silos.
Du arbeitest meist direkt an deinem Heimatort ‚Äì weil wir Kundenn√§he w√∂rtlich nehmen und uns Work-Life-Balance am Herzen liegt.
Du profitierst von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und hast je nach Kundensituation die M√∂glichkeit, von zuhause zu arbeiten.
Du bekommst ein Firmenhandy mit Vodafonevertrag (IPhone) auch f√ºr private Nutzung.
In der IT ist es wichtig immer auf dem neusten Stand zu bleiben, deshalb bringen die richtigen Trainings und Zertifikate deine Karriere voran. Neben unserer internen E-Learning-Plattform ‚ÄûAcademia‚Äú erm√∂glichen wir dir das Absolvieren von Schulungen und Zertifikaten.
Einen Teil des Bruttogehalts kannst du in CGI Aktien investieren ‚Äì bis maximal 3 % des Monatsgehalts geben wir f√ºr jeden Euro einen weiteren hinzu.
Au√üerdem beteiligen wir dich am Unternehmenserfolg: Du erh√§ltst eine Gewinnbeteiligung, die sich nach deiner individuellen Leistung, sowie der unternehmerischen finanziellen Zielerreichung des Unternehmens richtet.
Wir bieten verschiedene Mobilit√§ts-Modelle, wie Dienstfahrrad oder Firmenwagen.
Sabbatical oder Elternzeit werden unterst√ºtzt und sind bei uns kein Karriere-Stopper!
Wir sind an deiner Seite, auch wenn es einmal nicht so gut l√§uft. Du kannst Sonderurlaub nehmen, und unsere Beratungshotline stehen dir immer zur Verf√ºgung.
Eine Vielzahl an gemeinsamen Events und Freizeitaktivit√§ten im Team.


Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

Jobbeschreibung

Als Berater fungieren und durch gezielte Fragen tiefe Einblicke in die Gesch√§ftsbereiche und -prozesse gewinnen
Analysieren von Datens√§tzen, um verwertbare Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und datenbasierte Entscheidungsfindung zu unterst√ºtzen
Entwicklung und Implementierung statistischer Modelle zur L√∂sung komplexer Gesch√§ftsprobleme
Kommunikation von Erkenntnissen in √ºberzeugender und verst√§ndlicher Form zur Unterst√ºtzung datenbasierter Entscheidungsfindung

Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in einem verwandten Fachgebiet (z. B. Wirtschaft, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik)
Kenntnisse in SQL und/oder Python zur Datenanalyse und -modellierung
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Plattformen zur Datenspeicherung und -verarbeitung, Erfahrungen mit BigQuery sind von Vorteil
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung und Software wie Power BI oder Tableau
Eine proaktive und kollaborative Denkweise zusammen mit der F√§higkeit, effektiv in funktions√ºbergreifenden Teams zu arbeiten
Ausgezeichnete analytische F√§higkeiten und Probleml√∂sungskompetenz verbunden mit Erfahrungen, komplexe Ideen klar zu kommunizieren
Du lernst gerne, arbeitest praxisorientiert, √ºbernimmst Verantwortung und willst etwas ver√§ndern
Flie√üende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch


WAS** **WIR BIETEN


Modernes und hundefreundliches B√ºro im Herzen Berlins
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten f√ºr eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance
Wir arbeiten in funktions√ºbergreifenden und internationalen Teams und veranstalten regelm√§√üig Firmen- und Teamevents
28 Tage bezahlter Urlaub, plus Weihnachten und Silvester, sowie die M√∂glichkeit, zus√§tzlichen unbezahlten Urlaub zu nehmen
10 bezahlte Krankheitstage f√ºr Kinder pro Jahr
J√§hrliches Lern- und Entwicklungsbudget f√ºr den Kauf von Bildungsressourcen von bis zu 1.500 ‚Ç¨
Ausr√ºstung nach deiner Wahl: Macbook oder Lenovo, sowie weitere Ger√§te f√ºr die Einrichtung im Home-Office
Bezuschusste Mitgliedschaft im Urban Sports Club oder BVG Deutschland Ticket
Unterst√ºtzung beim mentalen Wohlbefinden, einschlie√ülich Einzelsitzungen, durch unseren Partner Likeminded

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Private equity funds have long been one of the most attractive investment opportunities, outperforming public market benchmarks, like the S&P 500. But these funds have also been difficult or impossible to access, especially for individuals. Onerous paperwork, high investment minimums (~10m) and difficulty picking a fund have all been hurdles that kept individuals out. Access has always been dominated by institutions or a select few. Enter Moonfare. Moonfare is revolutionising access to private equity using a fully digital platform that provides qualified investors access to selectively vetted top-performing funds within 15 minutes and at minimums as low as 50,000. Moonfare provides investors with

innovative reporting and the potential to trade their stakes in funds using our Secondary Market. We are introducing never before seen transparency and liquidity to private equity, and with our ongoing expansion across key markets in Europe and Asia, we are enabling investors around the world to reach further.The Moonfare team brings together individuals with a wealth of different backgrounds, from leading investment and private banks and private equity fund managers to disruptive tech startups, leading newspapers and top law firms. Moonfarians strive to keep growing and want to challenge the status quo while working as a team to deliver innovative solutions and the Moonfare vision. Data Engineer (m/f/d)As an integral part of our team, you will drive the day-to-day operation of Moonfare, which in turn will influence how our product evolves and how customers interact with the product resulting in more investments being made. You will be joining a small team of Data Engineers, ensuring that real-time data is available to our analysts through the design and development of robust data pipelines. As our business is expanding, so are our data sources, so you will be responsible for initiating scalable and streamlined solutions to provide reliable data to the business in a secure and timely manner.You will:Manage and scale Moonfares‚Äôs BI data infrastructure by developing and maintaining our data pipelines from ingestion through to storageAs a central figure of a small team, you will champion standards, processes and best practices in your areaConduct data analysis experiments, providing bespoke solutions to our stakeholders and giving them the information they need to succeedHigh-quality data is at the core of Moonfare‚Äôs success, you will help us continue our standards through data cleansing, coding consistency and data availabilityWe want to hear your ideas! You will bring all of your previous experiences and thoughts to the table and help us bring new tools, topics and methodologies to the BI TeamThe Next Moonfarian:3+ years working experience as a Data EngineerYou are an expert in designing and developing robust Data Pipelines using technologies such as Apache Spark and have a great understanding of data processingYou have proven programming experience with Python and Scala and you are also happy to review codeYou work with relational databases and advanced SQL queriesHands-on experience with Cloud data lakes Dremio would be a plus Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure, AWS in particularYou have experience with monitoring tools such as NewRelicYou collaborate with analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide efficient data solutionsYou contribute to the development and maintenance of data governance and security practicesExcellent written and verbal communication skills in English and have a clear and adaptive communication styleYou are solution-oriented and have excellent attention to detailYou have creative problem-solving abilities and a passion for dataIf you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!Invest in yourself:Ownership: All team members are empowered to bring ideas, make decisions and have impact. Participate in our equity program and share in our success.Transparency: Everyone at Moonfare is regularly updated on strategic progress, KPI tracking, product updates and changes.Growth: Not only will you grow in your role, you also have access to an individual growth budget of 1,500 or 2% of base salary (whichever is higher). Diversity: Our Diversity Committee ensures we hold ourselves accountable and continuously improve our D&I initiatives.We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We‚Äôre committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone

‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.Apply now!

Title: Senior Data Analyst B2C
Description:
Job Description:


Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
Start date: ASAP
Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas



Objectives of this Role:


Analyze and interpret market and user data to drive business decisions and improve product offerings.
Develop and maintain robust data architecture for efficient data processing and analysis.
Present data insights in a clear, actionable manner to stakeholders across the company.
Understand and navigate the complexities of app marketing and related data restrictions.
Support product development and commercial objectives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.



Responsibilities:


Design, implement, and manage backend data architecture to support analytics and reporting needs.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights about user behavior, product performance and growth roadmaps.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data in an understandable and actionable way.
Collaborate with product, business, engineering and management teams to align data initiatives with company goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.



Skills and Qualifications:


8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency.

  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
  • Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
  • Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.


Skills and Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
  • Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
  • Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
  • Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
  • Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
  • Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
  • Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
  • Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
  • Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
  • Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency.

Title: Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM
Description:
Um unseren Kunden passgenaue Produkte und einen bestm√∂glichen Service anbieten zu k√∂nnen, ist die Analyse und Interpretation von Daten essentiell. Als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Clients bei Verti liegt Dein Fokus auf der Datenaufbereitung und -analyse unserer Bestandskundendaten. Ziel ist es, unsere Kunden noch zielgruppengerechter anzusprechen und dadurch st√§rker an uns zu binden. Die Interaktion und der l√∂sungsorientierte Austausch im eigenen Team aber vor allem auch mit anderen datengetriebenen Unternehmensbereichen ist uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nutze die M√∂glichkeit, Deine Expertise erfolgreich einzubringen und Analysen zu erarbeiten, die Grundlage f√ºr richtungsweisende Entscheidungen bei Verti sein k√∂nnen. Werde Teil unseres dynamischen und multikulturellen Clients Bereichs.

Verti ist auf Wachstumskurs und sucht Dich zur Verst√§rkung als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Teltow bei Berlin.

Standort: Teltow

Startdatum: nach Vereinbarung

Die Position ist in Vollzeit zu besetzen.

Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM

Das erwartet Dich:


Extrahierung von Bestandskunden-Daten, Durchf√ºhrung von komplexen Datenanalysen und Erarbeitung von Prognosemodellen zur L√∂sung datengetriebener Fragestellungen und zur Generierung von Customer Insights entlang der gesamten Customer Journey
Definition von Zielstellungen f√ºr die bestandserhalt- oder kundenwertf√∂rdernden Aktionen gemeinsam mit dem CRM-Team
Evaluierung der Erreichung der genannten Ziele im Erfolgsmonitoring
Aufbereitung von aussagekr√§ftigen Dashboards zur kontinuierlichen Erfolgskontrolle und √úberwachung der Entwicklung der relevanten Customer KPIs
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen zur F√∂rderung des Bestandserhalts oder der Kundenwerterh√∂hung und Kommunikation dieser im eigenen Team sowie an das Management
Schnittstelle zu anderen datenverarbeitenden Bereichen im Unternehmen wie dem Data Warehouse, Versicherungsmathematik oder Data & Analytics


Das bringst Du mit:


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit relevantem Schwerpunkt (Betriebswirtschaft, Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik etc.) oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit entsprechender Weiterbildung
Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den g√§ngigen MS Office-Anwendungen
Sehr gutes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstst√§ndige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
F√§higkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verst√§ndlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsf√§higkeit und gute Pr√§sentationsf√§higkeiten
Arbeitserlaubnis der Europ√§ischen Union
Deutschkenntnisse Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse


Das bieten wir Dir:

Ein verl√§sslicher Partner in besonderen Zeiten: Wir bieten unseren Bewerberinnen und Bewerbern Verl√§sslichkeit und Perspektiven in der aktuellen Situation und stellen weiterhin ein. Dabei haben die Gesundheit und Sicherheit unserer Bewerberinnen und Bewerber sowie unserer Mitarbeitenden oberste Priorit√§t. Wir nutzen im Bewerbungsprozess virtuelle Medien (bspw. Video-Interviews) und halten uns bei pers√∂nlichen Gespr√§chen an definierte Hygiene- und Abstandsregeln.

Lokal und Global: Bei uns kannst Du Dich je nach Aufgabengebiet in internationale Projekte einbringen und in internationalen Teams innerhalb des MAPFRE-Konzerns arbeiten.

Innovation und Expertise: Ein Umfeld, in dem innovative, digitale Ideen wie in einem Start-up vorangetrieben werden - mit der Expertise aus mehr als 25 Jahren Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche.

Vielfalt und Nachhaltigkeit: Als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt stehen wir f√ºr Diversit√§t und Gerechtigkeit am Arbeitsplatz. Gender Pay Gap? Nicht bei Verti! Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Title: Causal Inference Analyst (Growth Team)
Description:
Our mission

We're making Africa the first cashless continent.

In 2017, over half the population in Sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reason‚Äîthe fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.

We're solving this by building financial services that just work: no account fees, instantly available, and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always work, you can still send money with Wave. In 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments. Now, we have millions of users across six countries and are growing fast.

Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent and that's where you come in.....

How you'll help us achieve it

We‚Äôre looking for an expert in statistical analysis focused on Experimentation and Causal Inference to join the Growth team at Wave. In this role, you will design, run, and analyze experiments in collaboration with product and operations teams to improve the product and customer experience. The aim is to apply rigorous statistical methods of causal inference and machine learning to grow our user base and optimize product features.

In this role you will

Be embedded closely with our operations and product teams.
Generate insights using customer, merchant and agent data, which will include running power analyses, statistical modeling, and data visualization.
Design, implement and analyze experiments to evaluate the causal impact of new product features, promos, and operational process changes.
Design causal inference analysis plans using longitudinal data.
Explore large data sets to identify growth drivers and generate testable hypotheses.
Build and apply machine learning models to improve product features and to analyze heterogeneous treatment effects (e.g. using random forests and related methods).
Take ownership of the analytics process - from project scoping and design through communicating findings to stakeholders.

Key Details

You can work remotely from anywhere (between UTC -5 and +2) with reliable internet access.
You‚Äôre willing to travel to one of our key markets once per year for ~6 days (Wave covers all costs). We also provide a yearly stipend of $800 to meet with coworkers.
Our salaries are competitive and are calculated using a transparent formula. For this role, depending on your level, we offer a salary of up to $134,400 USD (paid in your local currency equivalent), plus a generous equity package.
We run performance reviews twice a year and award bonuses or promotions to strong performers who have been with the company for more than six months.
Major benefits:
Subsidized health insurance for you and your dependents and retirement contributions (both vary from country to country).
6 months of fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance.
Flexible vacation, with most folks taking between 30-40 days per year.
$10,000 annual charitable donation matching.

Requirements

Education and Experience
Minimum Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Quantitative Social Science, Applied Psychology, or a related discipline. A Master's or PhD is a plus.
5+ years experience in applied data analytics or similar experience.
Demonstrated experience running product A/B tests, field experiments, and marketing experiments and conducting causal inference analyses.
Experience collaborating with and supporting cross-functional teams on data analysis and execution of experiments.
Experimentation and Causal Inference:
Deep knowledge of statistics and econometrics.
Expertise in experimental design including sampling, randomisation, stratification, and clustered designs.
Knowledge of non-experimental causal inference methodologies, such as propensity score matching, difference-in-differences analysis, and instrumental variable analysis.
Technical skills
Strong SQL skills with expertise in querying, manipulating and analyzing data.
Strong Python skills with expertise in data cleaning, manipulation, and statistical analysis (strong R skills are also acceptable and a willingness to quickly adapt to Python).
Proficiency applying machine learning methods for optimization and analysis of experimental data.
Familiarity with data visualization libraries.




You might be a good fit if you

Are proficient in SQL and Python/R.
Have a deep understanding of experimental methods and causal analysis.
Are a self-starter that excels at exploring problems and collaborating closely with operations teams to drive growth through data.
Like to ask questions of data and just have to find out the answers.

Our team

We have a rapidly growing in-country team in Senegal, C√¥te d'Ivoire, Mali, Burkina Faso, The Gambia, and Uganda, plus remote team members spread across the world.
We're deeply passionate about our mission of bringing radically affordable financial services to the people who need them most.
We foster autonomy for our employees. You'll own your projects at every stage, from understanding the problem to monitoring your solution in production.
We raised the largest Series A in Africa in 2021. Our world-class investors, include Founders Fund, Sequoia Heritage, Stripe, Ribbit Capital, Y Combinator, and Partech Africa.
In 2023, we were on Y Combinator's top 50 companies by revenue.




How to apply

Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and a cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.

We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.

Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Please note that Wave is not actively hiring in the U.S. at this time. Therefore, applications submitted by U.S.-based applicants will not be reviewed by our Talent team. We encourage all U.S.-based applicants to keep an eye on our Careers page for updates, as we will provide notifications once we resume hiring in the U.S.

Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English and a cover letter describing your interest in Wave and the role.

We review applications frequently and recommend that you apply to the role that most closely aligns with your skills, experience and career goals.

Wave is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Please note that Wave is not actively hiring in the U.S. at this time. Therefore, applications submitted by U.S.-based applicants will not be reviewed by our Talent team. We encourage all U.S.-based applicants to keep an eye on our Careers page for updates, as we will provide notifications once we resume hiring in the U.S.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Almanak Blockchain Labs is a data science and research-oriented company dedicated to understanding and designing the next generation of AI-driven web3.

The team is developing a permissionless E2E platform for building, training, optimizing, and deploying autonomous web3 financial agents.

Our culture is centered around the disciplined pursuit of knowledge, meritocracy, impact on our partners' businesses, and data-backed performance. We are a collective of executives and technologists from companies such as Uber, Morgan Stanley, Delphi Digital, and DBS.

The team seeks a talented Quantitative Researcher to join Almanak's R&D and Enterprise Trading Team.

In this role, you'll create and implement quantitative models for trading strategies and be at the forefront of AI agent applications in crypto trading.

Responsibilities:


Design & implement quantitative models for trading strategies
Conduct statistical analysis and data mining on large datasets
Perform back-testing and optimization of trading strategies
Collaborate with traders and developers to implement and refine models
Continuously monitor and improve the performance of trading strategies
Research and create new signals, new risk models and more efficient techniques for optimization & execution



Requirements


Min. Three years of experience in Python programming, with a strong emphasis on data science libraries
Demonstrated expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning applied in practical scenarios
Proven experience in developing and optimizing algorithmic trading systems
Practical knowledge in DeFi and blockchain interactions, preferably with Ethereum protocols
Understanding of traditional financial markets is a significant advantage
Experience with backtesting libraries to test and validate trading models against historical data
Ability to design and manage strategies for arbitrage and market-making
Experience with Solidity or Vyper is a plus



Benefits


Compensation: You'll receive competitive compensation, consisting of either fiat/crypto remuneration and an equity package in the core Almanak holding + bonuses
Flexible schedule & remote work: You can work remotely and manage your time independently. We want you to work from a place that makes you the happiest and contributes the most to your overall well-being!
Co-working space, gear, and education budgets: The company will invest in your comfort at work and in your personal growth
Impact: You'll work with some of the smartest people in the space and play a pivotal role in influencing the way some of the most popular crypto applications are built.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you‚Äôll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company‚Äôs success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What You‚Äôll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR101535

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, you‚Äôll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. You‚Äôll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What You‚Äôll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x) in the field of AI & Satellite Data
Description:
Build the Market Leader in Satellite Analytics with us at LiveEO

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our team. LiveEO leverages satellite imagery and artificial intelligence to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making across various industries. Examples are the precise detection of trees and their height in high resolution imagery to protect our customers power grids from tree fall, or the detection of dangerous construction work around critical infrastructure.

The successful candidate will join LiveEO‚Äôs AI team and will be a key contributor to the company‚Äôs effort to build state of the art geospatial AI models. The role involves building robust, automated and efficient data pipelines that transform terabytes of satellite data into ML-ready format for large scale model training.

You will have the ability to make a large personal impact on the development of the AI team and make significant contribution to foundational geospatial AI solutions of LiveEO. We don‚Äôt expect you to be an expert in all of the above but you should have the willingness to dive into new technical challenges and work on groundbreaking projects.

Tech Stack & Tools That We Are Using


Python: Rasterio, Numpy, PDAL, OSGEO, Geopandas, SQLAlchemy
Orchestration: Prefect, Anyscale/Ray
Databases: PostgreSQL, PostGIS
Infrastructure: Docker, AWS
GIS: QGIS, GDAL


Your challenge


Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines that efficiently handle large amounts of geospatial raster data
Orchestrate and automate data workflows using orchestration engines such as Prefect
Manage and optimize relational databases, ensuring data integrity and performance (experience with PostgreSQL, Snowflake preferred)
Engage in continuous improvement of the data processing frameworks by addressing challenges associated with large-scale Machine Learning pipelines and satelliate image processing, including data selection and observability, data and model versioning, automated data QA


Your profile


4+ years of experience in Data Engineering or a similar field
Experience in designing, building, and maintaining high-throughput data pipelines, with a strong background in handling large datasets, particularly raster data
Solid experience in designing, automating, implementing, and maintaining ETL pipelines
Experience with Python with a strong emphasis on writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code
Knowledge of parallel computing, including concurrent programming and performance optimization, to handle high-volume data processing tasks
A proactive approach to problem-solving, with a willingness to dive into and navigate challenging and broad topics, driving innovation to improve data quality and process efficiency
Understanding of geospatial and remote sensing data and processing techniques is a big plus
Hands on experience with tooling of Machine Learning Operations at large scale is a nice to have
Proficiency in managing relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Snowflake), with a strong understanding of database design and query optimization
You live in or you are willing to relocate to Berlin


Your Benefits


The opportunity to create a product that can improve business processes and lives across the globe
Flexible working hours and hybrid work model - we trust our employees to get their work done while maintaining a healthy work-life balance

A diverse and vibrant international environment of 30+ different nationalities


About Us

LiveEO is a well funded startup founded in 2018 and based in Berlin. Our primary service is modelling risk to our customers‚Äô assets and infrastructure from vegetation, ground deformation and change detection. We currently have around 100 employees from all over the world with a variety of backgrounds
Show more
HTML:
Build the Market Leader in Satellite Analytics with us at LiveEO

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our team. LiveEO leverages satellite imagery and artificial intelligence to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making across various industries. Examples are the precise detection of trees and their height in high resolution imagery to protect our customers power grids from tree fall, or the detection of dangerous construction work around critical infrastructure.

The successful candidate will join LiveEO‚Äôs AI team and will be a key contributor to the company‚Äôs effort to build state of the art geospatial AI models. The role involves building robust, automated and efficient data pipelines that transform terabytes of satellite data into ML-ready format for large scale model training.

You will have the ability to make a large personal impact on the development of the AI team and make significant contribution to foundational geospatial AI solutions of LiveEO. We don‚Äôt expect you to be an expert in all of the above but you should have the willingness to dive into new technical challenges and work on groundbreaking projects.

Tech Stack & Tools That We Are Using

  • Python: Rasterio, Numpy, PDAL, OSGEO, Geopandas, SQLAlchemy
  • Orchestration: Prefect, Anyscale/Ray
  • Databases: PostgreSQL, PostGIS
  • Infrastructure: Docker, AWS
  • GIS: QGIS, GDAL

Your challenge

  • Design, implement, and maintain data pipelines that efficiently handle large amounts of geospatial raster data
  • Orchestrate and automate data workflows using orchestration engines such as Prefect
  • Manage and optimize relational databases, ensuring data integrity and performance (experience with PostgreSQL, Snowflake preferred)
  • Engage in continuous improvement of the data processing frameworks by addressing challenges associated with large-scale Machine Learning pipelines and satelliate image processing, including data selection and observability, data and model versioning, automated data QA

Your profile

  • 4+ years of experience in Data Engineering or a similar field
  • Experience in designing, building, and maintaining high-throughput data pipelines, with a strong background in handling large datasets, particularly raster data
  • Solid experience in designing, automating, implementing, and maintaining ETL pipelines
  • Experience with Python with a strong emphasis on writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code
  • Knowledge of parallel computing, including concurrent programming and performance optimization, to handle high-volume data processing tasks
  • A proactive approach to problem-solving, with a willingness to dive into and navigate challenging and broad topics, driving innovation to improve data quality and process efficiency
  • Understanding of geospatial and remote sensing data and processing techniques is a big plus
  • Hands on experience with tooling of Machine Learning Operations at large scale is a nice to have
  • Proficiency in managing relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Snowflake), with a strong understanding of database design and query optimization
  • You live in or you are willing to relocate to Berlin

Your Benefits

  • The opportunity to create a product that can improve business processes and lives across the globe
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work model - we trust our employees to get their work done while maintaining a healthy work-life balance
  • We empower employees to drive their own career development, take initiative and have the freedom to be creative and bold
  • Not an overtime culture - we take care that overtime is done only as a necessity and always offset with time off and rest
  • Variety of team building opportunities - from jogging groups, team sports, bouldering and picnics
  • A collaborative and learning environment - frequent internal workshops, knowledge sharing sessions, journal clubs and hackathons
  • Office located in the centre of Berlin Kreuzberg with free fruit, nuts and drinks
  • Potential to participate in the employee stock option program
  • Urban Sports membership and BVG subsidy, corporate pension program
  • A diverse and vibrant international environment of 30+ different nationalities

About Us

LiveEO is a well funded startup founded in 2018 and based in Berlin. Our primary service is modelling risk to our customers‚Äô assets and infrastructure from vegetation, ground deformation and change detection. We currently have around 100 employees from all over the world with a variety of backgrounds

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Title: Data Analyst (m/w)
Description:
Wir, die Collaborative Marketing Club ‚Äì CMC GmbH, sind eine Dialogmarketingagentur mit dem Fokus auf Conversion-Rate-Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung. F√ºr unsere Kunden setzten wir Print-Mailing und Paketbeilagen Kampagnen im Full-Service von der Konzeption bis zur Durchf√ºhrung um.

Zu unseren Projekten z√§hlen adressierte und teiladressierte Print-Mailings zur Bestandskundenaktivierung und Neukundengewinnung. Wir arbeiten √ºberwiegend f√ºr Kunden aus dem Bereich E-Commerce, D2C-Brands und f√ºr online getriebene Gesch√§ftsmodelle.

Aufgaben

Deine Mission


Wir glauben: Als Unternehmen, das im B2B Vertrieb t√§tig ist, ben√∂tigen wir Daten, die die Rentabilit√§t jedes Kunden, jedes Produkts, jeder Dienstleistung, jedes Verk√§ufers, jedes Marketingkanals usw. detailliert aufzeigen, damit wir sehen k√∂nnen, wo unser Unternehmen erfolgreich ist und wo nicht.
Du √ºbernimmst die Verantwortung daf√ºr, diese Daten zu erheben, auszuwerten und Impulse f√ºr die erfolgreiche Skalierung unseres Unternehmens zu geben.
Zus√§tzlich unterst√ºtzt Du im Tagesgesch√§ft unsere Business Unit Mediaplanung bei der datengetriebenen Optimierung von Print-Mailing Kampagnen mit Fokus auf Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.


Deine Ziele


Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung von Tagesreporting, Wochenreporting, Monatsreporting, Quartalsreporting f√ºr unsere Business Kennzahlen, auf denen wir unser Unternehmen steuern.
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Verfahren zur Selektierung von Kundendaten f√ºr den Versand von Bestandskunden Mailings per Brief f√ºr unsere Kunden aus dem Bereich E-Commerce mit Fokus auf Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Ergebnisanalyse von Bestandskundenmailings und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen f√ºr Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Verfahren zur Selektierung von Kundendaten f√ºr den Versand von Bestandskunden Mailings per Brief f√ºr unsere Kunden im Rahmen der CMC Print-Mailing-Studie.
Analyse der Ergebnisse der CMC Print-Mailing-Studie, Aufbereitung und Interpretation der Daten f√ºr unseren Kunden und Auftraggeber der Studie, die Deutsche Post.


Qualifikation

Dein Profil


Du besitzt einen Hochschulabschluss in den Bereichen Wirtschaft, Marketing oder Informatik.
Du hast mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung als Data Analyst mit einem Hintergrund im Bereich Marketingdaten, vorzugsweise im E-Commerce-Umfeld.
Du besitzt Erfahrung in den Bereichen CRM, BI, Data Analytics.
Du hast solide Kenntnisse von Visualisierungstools (Tableau) und sehr gute Kenntnisse von Excel & SQL und der Arbeit mit Datenbanken.
Du hast verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.


Deine Kompetenzen


Effizienz ‚Äì Du produzierst signifikante Ergebnisse mit minimalem Aufwand.
Analytisch ‚Äì Du bist in der Lage, qualitative und quantitative Daten zu strukturieren und zu analysieren und daraus aufschlussreiche Schlussfolgerungen zu ziehen.
Detailverliebt ‚Äì Du stellst sicher, dass dir wichtige Details nicht durch die Maschen fallen und verhinderst, dass Projekte dadurch zum Scheitern gebracht werden.
Proaktives Handeln ‚Äì Du agierst, ohne dass man Dir genau sagt, was zu tun ist. Du bringst neue Ideen und Sichtweisen in unser Unternehmen.
Ausdauer ‚Äì Du demonstrierst Durchhalteverm√∂gen und den Willen, auch gro√üe Aufgaben anzugehen und zu meistern.
Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Du kannst Dich schnell an sich √§ndernde Priorit√§ten und Umfeldbedingungen anpassen.
Drucksituationen aushalten ‚Äì Du zeigst eine stabile Leistung, auch wenn Du unter hohem Druck oder Stress stehst.
Innovativ ‚Äì Du generierst innovative Ans√§tze f√ºr die L√∂sung von Problemen.
Enthusiasmus ‚Äì Du zeigst Leidenschaft und Begeisterung f√ºr Deine Arbeit.
Hoher Leistungsanspruch ‚Äì Du hast an Dich und an unser Team einen hohen Performance Anspruch und erwartest nicht weniger, als das wir die f√ºr uns bestm√∂gliche Leistung f√ºr unsere Kunden bringen.
Zielerreichung - Du zeigst einen starken Willen, Deine gesetzten Ziele zu erreichen.
Ehrlichkeit ‚Äì Du kommunizierst offen, ehrlich und transparent Deine W√ºnsche, Vorstellungen und Erwartungen.
Einf√ºhlungsverm√∂gen ‚Äì Du l√§sst deinen gegen√ºber aussprechen und versuchst, seinen Standpunkt zu verstehen.
Kritikf√§hig ‚Äì Du bittest aktiv um Feedback und reagierst ruhig und gelassen auf Kritik oder konstruktives Feedback.Teamf√§hig ‚Äì Du gehst auf deine Teammitglieder und Vorgesetzten zu und arbeitest mit ihnen zusammen, um gemeinsam ein sehr gutes Arbeitsergebnis im Team zu erzielen.


Benefits


Eine Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mitarbeiter.
Eine attraktive Verg√ºtung.
Ein harmonisches Zusammenarbeiten in einem jungen Team.
Regelm√§√üige Team-Events und Offsites.
Ein entspanntes Office mit viel Platz im Herzen von Berlin-Friedrichshain und ebenso eigenst√§ndiges mobiles Arbeiten.

  • Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Verfahren zur Selektierung von Kundendaten f√ºr den Versand von Bestandskunden Mailings per Brief f√ºr unsere Kunden aus dem Bereich E-Commerce mit Fokus auf Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.
  • Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Ergebnisanalyse von Bestandskundenmailings und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen f√ºr Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.
  • Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Verfahren zur Selektierung von Kundendaten f√ºr den Versand von Bestandskunden Mailings per Brief f√ºr unsere Kunden im Rahmen der CMC Print-Mailing-Studie.
  • Analyse der Ergebnisse der CMC Print-Mailing-Studie, Aufbereitung und Interpretation der Daten f√ºr unseren Kunden und Auftraggeber der Studie, die Deutsche Post.

Qualifikation

Dein Profil

  • Du besitzt einen Hochschulabschluss in den Bereichen Wirtschaft, Marketing oder Informatik.
  • Du hast mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung als Data Analyst mit einem Hintergrund im Bereich Marketingdaten, vorzugsweise im E-Commerce-Umfeld.
  • Du besitzt Erfahrung in den Bereichen CRM, BI, Data Analytics.
  • Du hast solide Kenntnisse von Visualisierungstools (Tableau) und sehr gute Kenntnisse von Excel & SQL und der Arbeit mit Datenbanken.
  • Du hast verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

Deine Kompetenzen

  • Effizienz ‚Äì Du produzierst signifikante Ergebnisse mit minimalem Aufwand.
  • Analytisch ‚Äì Du bist in der Lage, qualitative und quantitative Daten zu strukturieren und zu analysieren und daraus aufschlussreiche Schlussfolgerungen zu ziehen.
  • Detailverliebt ‚Äì Du stellst sicher, dass dir wichtige Details nicht durch die Maschen fallen und verhinderst, dass Projekte dadurch zum Scheitern gebracht werden.
  • Proaktives Handeln ‚Äì Du agierst, ohne dass man Dir genau sagt, was zu tun ist. Du bringst neue Ideen und Sichtweisen in unser Unternehmen.
  • Ausdauer ‚Äì Du demonstrierst Durchhalteverm√∂gen und den Willen, auch gro√üe Aufgaben anzugehen und zu meistern.
  • Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Du kannst Dich schnell an sich √§ndernde Priorit√§ten und Umfeldbedingungen anpassen.
  • Drucksituationen aushalten ‚Äì Du zeigst eine stabile Leistung, auch wenn Du unter hohem Druck oder Stress stehst.
  • Innovativ ‚Äì Du generierst innovative Ans√§tze f√ºr die L√∂sung von Problemen.
  • Enthusiasmus ‚Äì Du zeigst Leidenschaft und Begeisterung f√ºr Deine Arbeit.
  • Hoher Leistungsanspruch ‚Äì Du hast an Dich und an unser Team einen hohen Performance Anspruch und erwartest nicht weniger, als das wir die f√ºr uns bestm√∂gliche Leistung f√ºr unsere Kunden bringen.
  • Zielerreichung - Du zeigst einen starken Willen, Deine gesetzten Ziele zu erreichen.
  • Ehrlichkeit ‚Äì Du kommunizierst offen, ehrlich und transparent Deine W√ºnsche, Vorstellungen und Erwartungen.
  • Einf√ºhlungsverm√∂gen ‚Äì Du l√§sst deinen gegen√ºber aussprechen und versuchst, seinen Standpunkt zu verstehen.
  • Kritikf√§hig ‚Äì Du bittest aktiv um Feedback und reagierst ruhig und gelassen auf Kritik oder konstruktives Feedback.Teamf√§hig ‚Äì Du gehst auf deine Teammitglieder und Vorgesetzten zu und arbeitest mit ihnen zusammen, um gemeinsam ein sehr gutes Arbeitsergebnis im Team zu erzielen.

Benefits

  • Eine Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mitarbeiter.
  • Eine attraktive Verg√ºtung.
  • Ein harmonisches Zusammenarbeiten in einem jungen Team.
  • Regelm√§√üige Team-Events und Offsites.
  • Ein entspanntes Office mit viel Platz im Herzen von Berlin-Friedrichshain und ebenso eigenst√§ndiges mobiles Arbeiten.
