Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Private equity funds have long been one of the most attractive investment opportunities, outperforming public market benchmarks, like the S&P 500. But these funds have also been difficult or impossible to access, especially for individuals. Onerous paperwork, high investment minimums (~‚Ç¨10m) and difficulty picking a fund have all been hurdles that kept individuals out. Access has always been dominated by institutions or a select few. Enter Moonfare.

Moonfare is revolutionising access to private equity using a fully digital platform that provides qualified investors access to selectively vetted top-performing funds within 15 minutes and at minimums as low as ‚Ç¨50,000. Moonfare provides investors with innovative reporting and the potential to trade their stakes in funds using our Secondary Market. We are introducing never before seen transparency and liquidity to private equity, and with our ongoing expansion across key markets in Europe and Asia, we are enabling investors around the world to reach further.

The Moonfare team brings together individuals with a wealth of different backgrounds, from leading investment and private banks and private equity fund managers to disruptive tech startups, leading newspapers and top law firms. Moonfarians strive to keep growing and want to challenge the status quo while working as a team to deliver innovative solutions and the Moonfare vision.

Data Engineer (m/f/d)

As an integral part of our team, you will drive the day-to-day operation of Moonfare, which in turn will influence how our product evolves and how customers interact with the product resulting in more investments being made. You will be joining a small team of Data Engineers, ensuring that real-time data is available to our analysts through the design and development of robust data pipelines. As our business is expanding, so are our data sources, so you will be responsible for initiating scalable and streamlined solutions to provide reliable data to the business in a secure and timely manner.

You will:


Manage and scale Moonfares's BI data infrastructure by developing and maintaining our data pipelines from ingestion through to storage
As a central figure of a small team, you will champion standards, processes and best practices in your area
Conduct data analysis experiments, providing bespoke solutions to our stakeholders and giving them the information they need to succeed
High-quality data is at the core of Moonfare's success, you will help us continue our standards through data cleansing, coding consistency and data availability
We want to hear your ideas! You will bring all of your previous experiences and thoughts to the table and help us bring new tools, topics and methodologies to the BI Team


The Next Moonfarian:


3+ years working experience as a Data Engineer
You are an expert in designing and developing robust Data Pipelines using technologies such as Apache Spark and have a great understanding of data processing
You have proven programming experience with Python and Scala and you are also happy to review code
You work with relational databases and advanced SQL queries
Hands-on experience with Cloud data lakes
Dremio would be a plus
Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure, AWS in particular
You have experience with monitoring tools such as NewRelic
You collaborate with analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide efficient data solutions
You contribute to the development and maintenance of data governance and security practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and have a clear and adaptive communication style
You are solution-oriented and have excellent attention to detail
You have creative problem-solving abilities and a passion for data

If you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply!

Invest in yourself:


Ownership: All team members are empowered to bring ideas, make decisions and have impact. Participate in our equity program and share in our success.
Transparency: Everyone at Moonfare is regularly updated on strategic progress, KPI tracking, product updates and changes.
Growth: Not only will you grow in your role, you also have access to an individual growth budget of ‚Ç¨1,500 or 2% of base salary (whichever is higher).
Diversity: Our Diversity Committee ensures we hold ourselves accountable and continuously improve our D&I initiatives.


We understand the important role that diversity plays in our success. Different backgrounds, experiences and ideas push us further and raise the bar. We're committed to developing an inclusive and safe culture where everyone ‚Äî regardless of colour, race, religion, sex, origin, sexuality, disability, marital status, citizenship or gender identity ‚Äî knows that they are an integral part of the team and can bring their full potential to their work.

Apply now!

Title: Remote Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a meticulous Remote Data Integrity Analyst to ensure the accuracy and reliability of our data entries into company databases and CRM systems. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to data integrity.

Responsibilities:


Verify and correct data entries for accuracy and completeness.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data integrity.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly.
Perform regular data backups and digital filing.
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.


Qualifications:


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in data management is a plus.
Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace.
Familiarity with data entry software and tools.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.


Benefits:


Competitive hourly wage.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work from the comfort of your home.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Title: Patent Quality Data Analyst
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Patent Data Quality Analyst

fixed term 1 year

Hybrid

IPlytics maintains one of largest worldwide patent and standards databases including over 150 million documents across more than 100 different sources. We are looking for a Patent Data Quality Analyst who is willing to take responsibility to ensure the continuous data quality across all IPlytics databases including worldwide patent documents and standards documents.

As a patent data analyst, you are comfortable with working with large data sets of patent and standards documents to run statistical analysis, perform plausibility tests and ensure that result sets and data tables across all IPlytics databases are of the highest quality.

You are responsible for setting up data quality monitoring systems, define data quality standards, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers. You will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

To ensure success as a data quality analyst, you should exhibit extensive knowledge of data analysis techniques and experience in a similar role. A top-notch data quality analyst will be someone whose data analysis expertise results in reliable, consistent, complete data for our end users.

Your Tasks


Monitoring the patent data integration process to ensure consistency and quality from the sourcing of data to the processing of data and the integration of the data in tables and visual dashboards.
Working directly with our patent intelligence solution to perform plausibility tests ensuring that data tables and analytical results are accurate and robust.
Overseeing and guiding the approach to update, process and harmonize unstructured data across different data sources.
Reporting to the product team data issues and inaccuracies, developing strategies to improve the overall data quality across databases.
Creation of concepts to ensure the monitoring of data update schedules and automated data quality checks.
Define data quality standards.
Gain a deep understanding of the significance of the data and what the value of that data is to the end user with an understanding of how the end users use the data to answer their business questions.


Your Profile


Degree in Economics, Mathematics or Data Science
4+ years of data analyst experience - work experience with patent data preferred
A solid understanding of how to process and analyze patent data or comparable
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one's team members
Good problem-solving skills, attention to detail


Your Skills


Database: Familiarity with analyzing large data sets with Excel, Access, OpenRefine or other database refinement tools
Statistic ability: Experience with Stata, R, SPSS and other statistical software


We Offer


Open door culture, we progress and learn together and from each other
No Top-Down-Only approaches, we value your thoughts and ideas and improve by everyone's input
Urban Sports Membership options
A steep learning curve and cross-departmental insight
A modern workspace within an international tech community office


LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form: https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK , or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
As a Senior Data Scientist at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, developing and applying data science models to solve real world problems in the mobility sector. You will work closely alongside our Product & Engineering teams and build revenue-generating and cost-saving data products. As part of your role, you will interact with a wide range of business stakeholders from different countries. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.

YOUR CHALLENGE:


Lead the development and end to end implementation of machine learning models (e.g. demand forecasting, pricing optimization, customer lifetime value and churn prediction models)
Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.
Serve as a trusted expert in data science and ML, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data team.




ABOUT YOU:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in modeling business problems using machine learning techniques (incl. feature engineering, choice of model, implementation and evaluation)
You have demonstrated the ability to manage and/or mentor less experienced team members by sharing your data science knowledge
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
You continuously learn, you are a critical thinker and creative problem solver.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.


MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs' 'empty leg' journeys and have grown with our partners to over ‚Ç¨100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we're now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we've successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew! We are now poised for massive growth in 2021.


Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane
Show more
HTML:
As a Senior Data Scientist at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, developing and applying data science models to solve real world problems in the mobility sector. You will work closely alongside our Product & Engineering teams and build revenue-generating and cost-saving data products. As part of your role, you will interact with a wide range of business stakeholders from different countries. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.

YOUR CHALLENGE:

  • Lead the development and end to end implementation of machine learning models (e.g. demand forecasting, pricing optimization, customer lifetime value and churn prediction models)
  • Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
  • Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.
  • Serve as a trusted expert in data science and ML, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data team.



ABOUT YOU:

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
  • Proficiency in modeling business problems using machine learning techniques (incl. feature engineering, choice of model, implementation and evaluation)
  • You have demonstrated the ability to manage and/or mentor less experienced team members by sharing your data science knowledge
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
  • You continuously learn, you are a critical thinker and creative problem solver.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.

MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs' 'empty leg' journeys and have grown with our partners to over ‚Ç¨100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we're now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we've successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew! We are now poised for massive growth in 2021.

  • Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
  • Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
  • Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
  • Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
  • Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
  • Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
  • Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer - Energy Tech (w/m/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? Yes, at Green Fusion!

With our software for optimized control of heating systems in the real estate industry, we are combating climate change. Through digitalization and automation of control processes, we can not only reduce emissions but also energy consumption, thus actively driving the energy transition.

As a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, you support the Research & Development Team in keeping our promise to customers: to save 20% energy and reduce CO2 emissions in their buildings. With us, you have the opportunity to take on a job with real impact by developing algorithms, analyzing datasets, and advancing the optimization of our buildings.

Tasks


You will be responsible for developing production-ready algorithms and data pipelines that optimize energy system components, helping our customers to reduce their CO2 emissions and maximize energy efficiency in their buildings.
You will be working in cross-functional teams, consisting of energy automation engineers and software developers, to create new features for our smart home energy management system.
Additionally, you will be supporting our research team by conducting experimental data analysis to gain new insights and improve/invent energy optimization algorithms.
Together with you, we see this role developing in Data Science/ Machine Learning/ Data Engineering, depending on your interest and the development of our team.


Requirements


You have a minimum of three years of professional experience in data analysis.
You have comprehensive knowledge of Python and Git, as well as proficiency in SQL, GraphQL, and REST.
Additionally, you demonstrate proficiency in data science libraries such as Pandas, SciPy, and SciKit-Learn, and have experience working with time series data and a strong understanding of object-oriented programming.
Effective communication skills are critical for success in this position. You communicate effectively with various stakeholders, guide discussions, and foster a collaborative work environment.
You show proactiveness, have a strong desire to learn, and are interested in technical contexts.
You are fluent in English and have basic knowledge of the German language.


Benefits

üè†We provide flexibility in working hours and remote work options - even after the pandemic you can continue working from home.

üí°We believe in continuous learning and provide opportunities for personal and professional growth through job challenges, open feedback culture, and training budget for employees.

üå± With us, you can have a direct impact through your job by contributing to the fight against climate change and actively advancing the energy transition every day.

üíö We value our team and organize regular team events, workation with the team, or regular exchanges spaces to foster a positive work environment.

üíºWe offer employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.

üôå Finally, we are proud of our talented and purpose-driven team in Berlin and believe it's one of the best in the city. If you're interested, apply now and see for yourself!

While we are still pioneers today, with you, we can soon dominate the market! First in the DACH region, then across Europe.

You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and vibrant environment that passionately and ambitiously wants to actively shape the energy transition - and this can only succeed together!

We look forward to receiving your application - Fernanda will get in touch with you!

Title: Risk Intern - Data Analysis and BI (f/m/d)
Description:
Upvest, founded in 2017, enables any financial institution to offer great investment experiences to its customers. Upvest is an investment firm regulated by the German supervision authority (BaFin). The company currently employs 160+ people across Europe with its headquarters based in Berlin, Germany.

The company is backed by the world‚Äôs largest venture capital funds and investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Notion Capital, and ABN Amro Ventures, as well as by renowned fintech entrepreneurs (including Maximilian Tayenthal, founder of N26, and Felix Haas, founder of IDnow).

We‚Äôre looking for fintech enthusiasts to join us in creating the financial infrastructure of tomorrow. We‚Äôre building the first European Investment API to enable any financial institution offering a wide range of efficient and transparent investment products, such as stocks and ETFs in nominal, portfolio, and fractional form. Our mission and vision is to make investing as easy as spending money.




Your mission:

As a Risk Intern at Upvest, your mission will be to dive into various risk topics through conducting comprehensive impact assessments, refining internal risk models, and creating and maintaining dynamic BI dashboards. Your enthusiasm for solving complex problems will drive automation initiatives and support cross-functional data queries. With your analytical mindset and data-driven approach, you will ensure accurate modelling techniques and contribute to the development of robust market risk models, driving innovation in risk management while making a significant impact on our organisation‚Äôs resilience. Your contribution will empower the company to scale by driving data-driven decision-making and fostering strategic growth.




This role will give you the opportunity to:

Risk Model Management: Maintain and enhance our internal risk models using Python and SQL, designing and implementing enhancements to increase accuracy and broaden risk coverage.
Business Intelligence: Craft and refine dynamic dashboards, insightful reports, and alerts using Looker to boost data transparency and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) effectively.
Impact Assessments: Collaborate with other teams to conduct comprehensive impact assessments and calculate necessary collateral for potential clients, ensuring strategic decision-making.
Automation: Generate and implement creative ideas to automate risk analytics processes to enhance efficiency and accuracy, and explore new tools and technologies to bring the team to the next level.
ESG Scoring: Contribute to the development of robust Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) scoring metrics, promoting sustainable business practices.
FX Modeling: Engage in the development and refinement of FX models, driving informed financial strategies.
Research: Conduct thorough research and due diligence on various market-related topics to support data-driven decision-making and strategic initiatives.
Securities Onboarding: Partner with various departments to streamline the securities onboarding process for clients by conducting thorough risk assessments, communicating critical findings, and tracking the instrument onboarding.
Data Request Support: Utilise Looker, BigQuery, and Bloomberg to fulfil internal and cross-functional data requests, providing precise and actionable insights.




Job requirements:

Commitment to a 3 - 6 month full-time internship
Enthusiasm about fintech and investments and curiosity to learn more about risk management and data analysis at a BaFin-licenced investment firm
Bachelor/Master studies in Finance, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Economics with a quantitative focus
Skills in Python and SQL, or similar programming or database languages
Experience with Google CollabVBA or Google Apps Script a plus
Eagerness to learn and a passion for taking on new challenges
Curiosity for new technological developments which drives your pursuit of discovering and implementing innovative tools
A self starter with a strong sense of ownership for your work and an ability to iterate quickly
A team player who is excited about working with a diverse range of colleagues
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Willingness to relocate to Berlin (where our office is located) to experience the unique team culture at Upvest
Eligibility to work in Germany




Why Upvest?

We're working on solving a hard problem: fixing the European securities financial infrastructure that empowers more people to be able to invest. You have the opportunity to contribute to this change.
We invest in you. From access to a personal coach, development budget and plenty of opportunities to grow in your role.
We take hiring seriously with a strong focus on keeping a high bar when interviewing (equally important is that we hire decent people, who are passionate about their craft and helping us achieve our shared mission).
While we're not quite fully-remote, we are committed to being a flexible employer, as we understand you don't have to be in the office to do your best work.
We live a culture of empowerment, trust (that we hire the best people and get out of their way) and openness (there's a greater advantage in sharing information than keeping it to ourselves).




Our values:

Learn and grow. We aim high to shape our future. We give and request honest feedback knowing that we develop together. Progression over Perfection.
Team first. We make it easy for others. We value our differences and are open to others' opinions. We win and celebrate together! Team over Egos.
Own the outcome. Whether we win or we lose, we stand together. We are proactive and get the job done. Outcome over Process.
Tell the story. We always start with the why. We share knowledge to empower others. Transparency over Complexity.




Upvest is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
APCOA is Europe's leading parking operator with more than 50 years of industry expertise. With its 5,000 employees, the Group manages more than 1.8 million individual parking spaces at 13,000 locations in 13 European countries. The company is active in the areas of parking, charging, technologies, and urban solutions. With its consistent ‚Äúasset light‚Äù business model, APCOA is the trusted partner who maximizes value for private and public real estate owners.




Via its open digital platform, APCOA FLOW, the company connects on-street and off-streetcar parks with owners, partners, customers and their vehicles. Based on this technology, APCOA is transforming its car parks into urban hubs, creating the physical and digital infrastructure for mobility, logistics, EV charging and a wide range of innovative services that enable a more convenient mobility experience.




The environment also benefits: With its digital services and intelligent Traffic Management System, the company actively contributes to the reduction of emissions in cities by decreasing the volume of logistics traffic and vehicles searching for parking. By connecting parking, mobility, and proximity services for urban living, APCOA is positioned to become an integral part of the digital and physical Smart City ecosystem.




To strengthen the team in Berlin, we are looking for an:




Senior Data Analyst (all genders)




Responsibilities:

Develop and define comprehensive tracking specifications, data models, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to evaluate our product and engineering strategies effectively.
Design and create dashboards that showcase product performance for the organization and teams.
Collaborate with Product Management to convert business requirements into robust data models and actionable insights.
Perform complex data analyses to detect trends and patterns, providing actionable insights to enhance product and operational performance.
Lead ad hoc analyses to inform strategic decisions across product, operations, and business spheres.
Collaborates closely with Data Engineers to ensure optimal data pipeline architecture for advanced analytics, reporting, and data-driven decision-making.
Help us become a data-driven organization and offer expert advice on qualitative analysis and experimental design.
Establish and define data analysis processes. You‚Äôll be the first person to join this team, so you will have the opportunity to shape the data analytics unit.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Senior Data Analyst in a data driven organization.
Demonstrated experience in utilizing data build tool for transforming data in the warehouse and preparing it for analysis.
Expertise in database management and querying with both SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra) technologies, as well as proficiency in programming with R, Python, or similar data analysis languages.
Experience creating dashboards with CleverTap, Metabase or similar analytics tools.
Extensive practical experience in documenting data models and tracking specifications.
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Independent work ethic with a proven track record of initiative and successful project completion.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Leadership experience or potential with the capability to mentor future team members.
Deep understanding of analytics and data sciences.




Our Offer to you:

Mission driven and customer-centric company and tech organization, with strong focus on people and their professional growth.
Opportunity to impact positively millions of people using our products every day.
Varied tasks and challenges with a great deal of creative freedom
Room for creativity in your work and the chance to actively contribute to the success of the company.
Flat hierarchies, direct communication channels and a very good and open team atmosphere in an intercultural environment
An attractive workplace with very good public transport connections
The possibility to also work from home.
Attractive and performance-oriented salary packages
International cooperation with colleagues and business partners throughout Europe




Have we aroused your interest? Then please only use our online application form to send us your complete application documents (cover letter, CV, references), stating your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date:




APCOA Holdings GmbH

Max H√∂lzli

Human Resources Specialist

max.hoelzli@apcoa.eu

www.apcoa.com

www.valuespaces.com




BEWERBEN

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
remote - Germany, Spain, Czech Republic, Portugal, Slovakia or Austria | Full-time | Start ASAP

About us üöÄ

We accelerate the growth of digital companies by providing tailored funding solutions and data-driven financial insights. Our mission is to refine capital for economies to come. We want to enable every company to access funding that'll help them to thrive.

As a product- and tech-driven company we are founded by a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs. We are backed by Tier 1 venture capital investors that have also backed the likes of Stripe, Trade Republic, Telegram, Monday.com and Sorare.

Our values üí™üèº

We value flat hierarchies, full ownership and responsibility. Trust and open, honest communication are crucial to us, as it makes everything else easier. We work together and grow as a team.

Focus on Execution: We love and live off great ideas, but to create value we need to focus on execution.

Don't Fear Failure: We know that failure is an innate part of learning and success, so we value these experiences and take them as opportunities to try again and get better.

Trust Your Team: We trust our peers to do their best to achieve our shared goals, support each other and share their feedback so we can all grow and develop.

Your contribution to our success ü§ì


You will write production-grade Python code for data applications that will be directly integrated into re:cap's platform
You will collaborate with our backend team (working mostly with Go) to ensure our solutions are successfully implemented from end-to-end
You will interface with different teams to gather business requirements and prototype solutions (e.g., Streamlit applications or Python scripts)
You will build pipelines to move data from various third-party sources into re:cap's data warehouse in Google BigQuery
You will maintain our data warehouse and ensure our data transformations are efficient and well structured using dbt and SQL


Who we are looking for üïµüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è


You are quick to iterate on your solutions
Your attention to detail ensures that the data you provide supports critical business decisions accurately
You're comfortable wearing multiple hats, from supporting the finance department with data analysis to building data pipelines and deploying data applications
You can effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences and translate their requirements into code
Experience with tech-driven and distributed companies is a plus
You have a valid EU work permit and reside within the EU. re:cap does not offer visa or relocation support at the moment


Our tech stack üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª


Programming languages: Python, SQL and Go
Data ingestion: Airbyte
Data transformation: dbt
Data warehouse: Google BigQuery
Orchestration: Dagster
Analysis & reporting: Looker Studio, Streamlit
DevOps: AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, GitHub
Experience with our stack isn't a must


What you can expect ü™¥


Remote first. Our team is located all over Germany and Europe, with the flexibility of 100% home office. However, if you are in Berlin you are more than welcome to come around the office and maybe even bring your furry friend üê∂
Stock options. Every employee receives stocks, because our success is also your success
Development opportunities. Because we care about your growth, we have regular feedback talks as well as set paths for the development of each employee
The latest tech equipment. Every new team member receives an Apple MacBook Air to guarantee smooth productivity
Flexibility. We offer flexible working hours and value asynchronous communication as well. On top we offer 25 vacation days
Team building. Meet the team at in-person on-sites, get a buddy to fully integrate into the company and join other team events
International travel health insurance. Prioritizing your well-being with comprehensive coverage, we guarantee your peace of mind wherever your travels take you
Workation. Experience the blend of work and leisure with our worldwide new benefit catering to your work-away-from-home needs
We care about security. You will receive 1password family membership

Even if not all of these points fit 100% we encourage you to apply! We hire also for attitude, not just for knowledge and are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Show more
HTML:
remote - Germany, Spain, Czech Republic, Portugal, Slovakia or Austria | Full-time | Start ASAP

About us üöÄ

We accelerate the growth of digital companies by providing tailored funding solutions and data-driven financial insights. Our mission is to refine capital for economies to come. We want to enable every company to access funding that'll help them to thrive.

As a product- and tech-driven company we are founded by a team of experienced fintech entrepreneurs. We are backed by Tier 1 venture capital investors that have also backed the likes of Stripe, Trade Republic, Telegram, Monday.com and Sorare.

Our values üí™üèº

We value flat hierarchies, full ownership and responsibility. Trust and open, honest communication are crucial to us, as it makes everything else easier. We work together and grow as a team.

Focus on Execution: We love and live off great ideas, but to create value we need to focus on execution.

Don't Fear Failure: We know that failure is an innate part of learning and success, so we value these experiences and take them as opportunities to try again and get better.

Trust Your Team: We trust our peers to do their best to achieve our shared goals, support each other and share their feedback so we can all grow and develop.

Your contribution to our success ü§ì

  • You will write production-grade Python code for data applications that will be directly integrated into re:cap's platform
  • You will collaborate with our backend team (working mostly with Go) to ensure our solutions are successfully implemented from end-to-end
  • You will interface with different teams to gather business requirements and prototype solutions (e.g., Streamlit applications or Python scripts)
  • You will build pipelines to move data from various third-party sources into re:cap's data warehouse in Google BigQuery
  • You will maintain our data warehouse and ensure our data transformations are efficient and well structured using dbt and SQL

Who we are looking for üïµüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

  • You are quick to iterate on your solutions
  • Your attention to detail ensures that the data you provide supports critical business decisions accurately
  • You're comfortable wearing multiple hats, from supporting the finance department with data analysis to building data pipelines and deploying data applications
  • You can effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences and translate their requirements into code
  • Experience with tech-driven and distributed companies is a plus
  • You have a valid EU work permit and reside within the EU. re:cap does not offer visa or relocation support at the moment

Our tech stack üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª

  • Programming languages: Python, SQL and Go
  • Data ingestion: Airbyte
  • Data transformation: dbt
  • Data warehouse: Google BigQuery
  • Orchestration: Dagster
  • Analysis & reporting: Looker Studio, Streamlit
  • DevOps: AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, GitHub
  • Experience with our stack isn't a must

What you can expect ü™¥

  • Remote first. Our team is located all over Germany and Europe, with the flexibility of 100% home office. However, if you are in Berlin you are more than welcome to come around the office and maybe even bring your furry friend üê∂
  • Stock options. Every employee receives stocks, because our success is also your success
  • Development opportunities. Because we care about your growth, we have regular feedback talks as well as set paths for the development of each employee
  • The latest tech equipment. Every new team member receives an Apple MacBook Air to guarantee smooth productivity
  • Flexibility. We offer flexible working hours and value asynchronous communication as well. On top we offer 25 vacation days
  • Team building. Meet the team at in-person on-sites, get a buddy to fully integrate into the company and join other team events
  • International travel health insurance. Prioritizing your well-being with comprehensive coverage, we guarantee your peace of mind wherever your travels take you
  • Workation. Experience the blend of work and leisure with our worldwide new benefit catering to your work-away-from-home needs
  • We care about security. You will receive 1password family membership
  • Choice. You get a monthly budget to finance a benefit of your choice

Even if not all of these points fit 100% we encourage you to apply! We hire also for attitude, not just for knowledge and are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

What comes after you apply? üßöüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

  • Get to know re:cap

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company‚Äôs performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You‚Äôll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That‚Äôs what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. Because in the fight against climate change, we don‚Äôt see renewable energy as part of the solution - we believe it must be the solution. With us, you‚Äôll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.

But there‚Äôs more work to be done - that‚Äôs why we need you to join us.

Job Description

If you‚Äôre a skilled Data Engineer with experience inC#, Python,Azure, Synapse or Databricks,you can start a career that helps to solve the climate crisis, with Statkraft. You will be a key resource in the development of our cloud data platform, realizing business value with data.

Working in Integration and RPA

We are a specialist team responsible for delivering integration, data solutions and RPA to all business areas in Statkraft across the globe. Some examples are:

Delivering customized integration solutions that connects the different business areas, business processes and systems that supports the whole value chain in Statkraft
Processes, structures, stores, and quality assure a huge amount of data every day
Automating business process and data harvesting with RPA

On a technical level, we deliver on a wide technology stack ranging from e.g. C#, Python, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure API Management, Azure Data Factory, and more.

Integration, data, and RPA are essential for Statkraft to remain a market leader in renewable energy production, and we are now looking for great people to join our team. If you enjoy challenging yourself and working in a competitive industry where technology is evolving the business we operate in, then we would love to talk to you. If you are motivated by working for a company that is a key part of the solution for creating an environmentally sustainable society then Statkraft is the company for you.

As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with business users in many parts of the company across the globe. As Data Engineer in the Integration and RPA team, you‚Äôll:

Develop core functionality for our cloud data platform with a solid focus on business insight, innovation, performance, data quality and self-service
Explore new and challenging data use cases by collaborating with various business and IT teams
Help Statkraft shape our digital foundation for the future

Qualifications

We look for experienced Data Engineers with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes knowledge in:

Relevant Data Engineer experience
Relevant Azure experience
Good C# or Python development skills
Eager to learn more about new trends and technologies
Fluent in English and preferably Norwegian

Experiences in these areas are also useful in your role:

Understanding of time series
Understanding of the energy management, trading, or finance domains
Defining and scoping data quality measures
Experience with Azure DevOps

At Statkraft, we‚Äôre always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to explore, learn, lead, teach and help others learn.

Additional Information

What we offer

Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation
The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgrounds
A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principles
Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we‚Äôre a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance
Relocation support if needed.

Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.

Statkraft's vision is to renew the way the world is powered. To navigate the complex journey ahead, we need every voice at the table.

We therefore work actively to be a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome all applicants regardless of background, gender, age, sexual orientation, religious belief, ethnicity, nationality or disability.

We evaluate applications for this role on a rolling basis, so please apply with your CV through our career pages as soon as possible.

Location: Oslo, Berlin or D√ºsseldorf.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you‚Äôll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company‚Äôs success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What You‚Äôll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you‚Äôve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

Description:
Wir, die Collaborative Marketing Club ‚Äì CMC GmbH, sind eine Dialogmarketingagentur mit dem Fokus auf Conversion-Rate-Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung. Als Erg√§nzung f√ºr unser Team suchen wir zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Termin Dich als unser neues Teammitglied. Gemeinsam mit Dir wollen wir f√ºr unsere Kunden die bestm√∂gliche Arbeit abliefern und unsere Kunden zufrieden stellen.

Aufgaben

Deine Mission


Wir glauben: Als Unternehmen, das im B2B Vertrieb t√§tig ist, ben√∂tigen wir Daten, die die Rentabilit√§t jedes Kunden, jedes Produkts, jeder Dienstleistung, jedes Verk√§ufers, jedes Marketingkanals usw. detailliert aufzeigen, damit wir sehen k√∂nnen, wo unser Unternehmen erfolgreich ist und wo nicht.
Du √ºbernimmst die Verantwortung daf√ºr, diese Daten zu erheben, auszuwerten und Impulse f√ºr die erfolgreiche Skalierung unseres Unternehmens zu geben.
Zus√§tzlich unterst√ºtzt Du im Tagesgesch√§ft unsere Business Unit Mediaplanung bei der datengetriebenen Optimierung von Print-Mailing Kampagnen mit Fokus auf Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.


Deine Ziele


Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung von Tagesreporting, Wochenreporting, Monatsreporting, Quartalsreporting f√ºr unsere Business Kennzahlen, auf denen wir unser Unternehmen steuern.
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Verfahren zur Selektierung von Kundendaten f√ºr den Versand von Bestandskunden Mailings per Brief f√ºr unsere Kunden aus dem Bereich E-Commerce mit Fokus auf Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Ergebnisanalyse von Bestandskundenmailings und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen f√ºr Conversionrate Optimierung und Return on Ad Spend Optimierung.
Aufbau und Weiterentwicklung der Verfahren zur Selektierung von Kundendaten f√ºr den Versand von Bestandskunden Mailings per Brief f√ºr unsere Kunden im Rahmen der CMC Print-Mailing-Studie.
Analyse der Ergebnisse der CMC Print-Mailing-Studie, Aufbereitung und Interpretation der Daten f√ºr unseren Kunden und Auftraggeber der Studie, die Deutsche Post.


Qualifikation

Dein Profil


Du besitzt einen Hochschulabschluss in den Bereichen Wirtschaft, Marketing oder Informatik.
Du hast mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung als Data Analyst mit einem Hintergrund im Bereich Marketingdaten, vorzugsweise im E-Commerce-Umfeld.
Du besitzt Erfahrung in den Bereichen CRM, BI, Data Analytics.
Du hast solide Kenntnisse von Visualisierungstools (Tableau) und sehr gute Kenntnisse von Excel & SQL und der Arbeit mit Datenbanken.
Du hast verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.


Deine Kompetenzen


Effizienz ‚Äì Du produzierst signifikante Ergebnisse mit minimalem Aufwand.
Analytisch ‚Äì Du bist in der Lage, qualitative und quantitative Daten zu strukturieren und zu analysieren und daraus aufschlussreiche Schlussfolgerungen zu ziehen.
Detailverliebt ‚Äì Du stellst sicher, dass dir wichtige Details nicht durch die Maschen fallen und verhinderst, dass Projekte dadurch zum Scheitern gebracht werden.
Proaktives Handeln ‚Äì Du agierst, ohne dass man Dir genau sagt, was zu tun ist. Du bringst neue Ideen und Sichtweisen in unser Unternehmen.
Ausdauer ‚Äì Du demonstrierst Durchhalteverm√∂gen und den Willen, auch gro√üe Aufgaben anzugehen und zu meistern.
Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Du kannst Dich schnell an sich √§ndernde Priorit√§ten und Umfeldbedingungen anpassen.
Drucksituationen aushalten ‚Äì Du zeigst eine stabile Leistung, auch wenn Du unter hohem Druck oder Stress stehst.
Innovativ ‚Äì Du generierst innovative Ans√§tze f√ºr die L√∂sung von Problemen.
Enthusiasmus ‚Äì Du zeigst Leidenschaft und Begeisterung f√ºr Deine Arbeit.
Hoher Leistungsanspruch ‚Äì Du hast an Dich und an unser Team einen hohen Performance Anspruch und erwartest nicht weniger, als das wir die f√ºr uns bestm√∂gliche Leistung f√ºr unsere Kunden bringen.
Zielerreichung - Du zeigst einen starken Willen, Deine gesetzten Ziele zu erreichen.
Ehrlichkeit ‚Äì Du kommunizierst offen, ehrlich und transparent Deine W√ºnsche, Vorstellungen und Erwartungen.
Einf√ºhlungsverm√∂gen ‚Äì Du l√§sst deinen gegen√ºber aussprechen und versuchst, seinen Standpunkt zu verstehen.
Kritikf√§hig ‚Äì Du bittest aktiv um Feedback und reagierst ruhig und gelassen auf Kritik oder konstruktives Feedback.Teamf√§hig ‚Äì Du gehst auf deine Teammitglieder und Vorgesetzten zu und arbeitest mit ihnen zusammen, um gemeinsam ein sehr gutes Arbeitsergebnis im Team zu erzielen.


Benefits


Eine Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mitarbeiter.
Eine attraktive Verg√ºtung.
Ein harmonisches Zusammenarbeiten in einem jungen Team.
Regelm√§√üige Team-Events und Offsites.
Ein entspanntes Office mit viel Platz im Herzen von Berlin-Friedrichshain und ebenso eigenst√§ndiges mobiles Arbeiten.


Du liebst Daten und m√∂chtest sie in spannende Marketingprojekte umsetzen? Dann bewirb dich jetzt als Data Analyst bei Collaborative Marketing Club - CMC GmbH!

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Almanak Blockchain Labs is a data science and research-oriented company dedicated to understanding and designing the next generation of AI-driven web3.

The team is developing a permissionless E2E platform for building, training, optimizing, and deploying autonomous web3 financial agents.

Our culture is centered around the disciplined pursuit of knowledge, meritocracy, impact on our partners' businesses, and data-backed performance. We are a collective of executives and technologists from companies such as Uber, Morgan Stanley, Delphi Digital, and DBS.

The team seeks a talented Quantitative Researcher to join Almanak's R&D and Enterprise Trading Team.

In this role, you'll create and implement quantitative models for trading strategies and be at the forefront of AI agent applications in crypto trading.

Responsibilities:


Design & implement quantitative models for trading strategies
Conduct statistical analysis and data mining on large datasets
Perform back-testing and optimization of trading strategies
Collaborate with traders and developers to implement and refine models
Continuously monitor and improve the performance of trading strategies
Research and create new signals, new risk models and more efficient techniques for optimization & execution



Requirements


Min. Three years of experience in Python programming, with a strong emphasis on data science libraries
Demonstrated expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning applied in practical scenarios
Proven experience in developing and optimizing algorithmic trading systems
Practical knowledge in DeFi and blockchain interactions, preferably with Ethereum protocols
Understanding of traditional financial markets is a significant advantage
Experience with backtesting libraries to test and validate trading models against historical data
Ability to design and manage strategies for arbitrage and market-making
Experience with Solidity or Vyper is a plus



Benefits


Compensation: You'll receive competitive compensation, consisting of either fiat/crypto remuneration and an equity package in the core Almanak holding + bonuses
Flexible schedule & remote work: You can work remotely and manage your time independently. We want you to work from a place that makes you the happiest and contributes the most to your overall well-being!
Co-working space, gear, and education budgets: The company will invest in your comfort at work and in your personal growth
Impact: You'll work with some of the smartest people in the space and play a pivotal role in influencing the way some of the most popular crypto applications are built.

Title: Associate Energy Data Management Analyst (f,m,d)
Description:
About the Role

We are looking for an Associate Energy Data Management Analyst to join our Berlin office on Ernst-Reuter-Platz. This person will provide direct support to our Energiedatamanager to ensure the smooth running of daily and monthly balancing and billing operations at Trailstone.

In this role you will have the opportunity to learn and understand the German energy market from the bottom up, becoming a go-to data specialist for the business in time. As a naturally collaborative role, you will also have the opportunity to work with Trailstone's Originators, Analysts and external Market participants as an important source of data, key to their business decisions. We are really excited about this role, and the exposure this person will have as they develop within our business.

This will be a full-time role, owning the following responsibilities:


Energy Data Analysis and Processing: Owning the responsibility for analysing incoming data in the meter data management area. This includes identifying and resolving issues, as well as conducting plausibility checks of preliminary values.
Coordination with Market Partners: Provide close coordination with other market partners to ensure consistent smooth data transfers. This involves communication and coordination regarding the transmission and exchange of data.
Master Data Administration: Taking charge of administering the master data of metering points, requiring accurate and careful work.


About You

This hire will be joining a small team in Berlin to support and strengthen our Energy Trading Operations through key data management. An interest in the Renewable Energy arena, and attention to detail will be the key to success here. As an Associate Level within our business, this role is best suited to someone looking to start their career after recently completing their academic studies. In addition, we are looking for somebody with the following attributes:


Education: A recently completed "Ausbildung" / commercial training placement (e.g. Industrial Clerk of IT System Management Clerk) or a Bacherlor's Degree is required.
IT Knowledge: A very good understanding of IT systems and processes is essential to effectively manage the complex data flows and systems in the energy sector.
Analytical Skills: Enjoyment in analysing and elucidating unknown connections, along with an analytical, goal-oriented and solution-focused mindset, are crucial.
Independence and Initiative: The ability to work independently and show initiative is critical for success in this role.
Industry Experience: Some experience in the energy sector is desirable to understand the specific challenges and requirements of the industry. However this is not essential to be considered.
Language Skills: At least C1 Level in German, as well as B1 or B2 Level in English.


Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and individuals from minority backgrounds often hesitate to apply for positions unless they fulfil every requirement. We're committed to building an inclusive and authentic workplace for everyone. So if this position excites you but your qualifications or experience don't perfectly align with the job description, we still urge you to apply. You could be the ideal candidate for this role, or perhaps another opportunity within our expanding business.

What we offer


Competitive compensation and participation in Trailstone's discretionary bonus plan.
The opportunity to help shape a new business area and grow with it yourself.
25 days of annual holiday entitlement, not including public holidays.
A sociable working environment in a brand-new office space with an open culture.
Flat hierarchies and a no-ego culture for direct decision-making processes without the bureaucracy.
Eligibility to receive external and internal training in accordance with our Learning & Development Policy.
Eligibility for an annual employer contribution towards your private pension.


Here at Trailstone...

We recognise the importance of diversity in driving our success. We actively seek to further diversify our organisation and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, nationalities, ethnicities, genders, ages, religions, disabilities and sexual orientations, as well as veterans and individuals from other underrepresented groups.

We understand that diversity is not just about representation but about bringing together a multitude of perspectives to foster innovation and drive better decision-making. We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and are committed to building a workplace where everyone can thrive and contribute to our collective success.

Join us in our journey to build a more inclusive empowered future.

About Trailstone

Trailstone is a global energy and technology company, operating at the intersection of renewable and conventional power. We trade energy in global markets, and we provide a best-in-class service to manage the inherent intermittency of renewable power generation across the short, medium and long term. As an energy trader, we buy and sell electricity and gas which is physically delivered on the grids, and we leverage our physical market knowledge to trade financial commodities. As a provider of renewable energy management services, we take on the complexity of managing renewable power across different countries so that our customers can focus on their core mission of investment and growth. Trailstone offers an efficient, fully automated front-to-back renewable power management platform underpinned by our long-standing market experience, proprietary technology, data analytics and meteorology.

In addition, we are looking for somebody with the following attributes:

  • Education: A recently completed "Ausbildung" / commercial training placement (e.g. Industrial Clerk of IT System Management Clerk) or a Bacherlor's Degree is required.
  • IT Knowledge: A very good understanding of IT systems and processes is essential to effectively manage the complex data flows and systems in the energy sector.
  • Analytical Skills: Enjoyment in analysing and elucidating unknown connections, along with an analytical, goal-oriented and solution-focused mindset, are crucial.
  • Independence and Initiative: The ability to work independently and show initiative is critical for success in this role.
  • Industry Experience: Some experience in the energy sector is desirable to understand the specific challenges and requirements of the industry. However this is not essential to be considered.
  • Language Skills: At least C1 Level in German, as well as B1 or B2 Level in English.

Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and individuals from minority backgrounds often hesitate to apply for positions unless they fulfil every requirement. We're committed to building an inclusive and authentic workplace for everyone. So if this position excites you but your qualifications or experience don't perfectly align with the job description, we still urge you to apply. You could be the ideal candidate for this role, or perhaps another opportunity within our expanding business.

What we offer

  • Competitive compensation and participation in Trailstone's discretionary bonus plan.
  • The opportunity to help shape a new business area and grow with it yourself.
  • 25 days of annual holiday entitlement, not including public holidays.
  • A sociable working environment in a brand-new office space with an open culture.
  • Flat hierarchies and a no-ego culture for direct decision-making processes without the bureaucracy.
  • Eligibility to receive external and internal training in accordance with our Learning & Development Policy.
  • Eligibility for an annual employer contribution towards your private pension.

Here at Trailstone...

We recognise the importance of diversity in driving our success. We actively seek to further diversify our organisation and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, nationalities, ethnicities, genders, ages, religions, disabilities and sexual orientations, as well as veterans and individuals from other underrepresented groups.

We understand that diversity is not just about representation but about bringing together a multitude of perspectives to foster innovation and drive better decision-making. We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and are committed to building a workplace where everyone can thrive and contribute to our collective success.

Join us in our journey to build a more inclusive empowered future.

About Trailstone

Trailstone is a global energy and technology company, operating at the intersection of renewable and conventional power. We trade energy in global markets, and we provide a best-in-class service to manage the inherent intermittency of renewable power generation across the short, medium and long term. As an energy trader, we buy and sell electricity and gas which is physically delivered on the grids, and we leverage our physical market knowledge to trade financial commodities. As a provider of renewable energy management services, we take on the complexity of managing renewable power across different countries so that our customers can focus on their core mission of investment and growth. Trailstone offers an efficient, fully automated front-to-back renewable power management platform underpinned by our long-standing market experience, proprietary technology, data analytics and meteorology.

Description:

In dieser Funktion haben Sie die M√∂glichkeit, den deutschen Energiemarkt von der Pike auf zu lernen und zu verstehen, um rechtzeitig zum Datenspezialisten f√ºr das Unternehmen zu werden. Als nat√ºrlich kollaborative Rolle haben Sie auch die M√∂glichkeit, mit den Originatoren, Analysten und externen Marktpartnern von Trailstone als wichtige Datenquelle zu arbeiten, die f√ºr ihre Gesch√§ftsentscheidungen entscheidend ist. Wir sind wirklich begeistert von dieser Rolle und der Exposition, die diese Person haben wird, w√§hrend sie sich in unserem Unternehmen weiterentwickeln kann.




Dies wird eine Vollzeitstelle mit folgenden Aufgaben:

Energiedatenanalyse und -verarbeitung: Verantwortung f√ºr die Analyse eingehender Daten im Bereich Messdatenmanagement. Dazu geh√∂ren die Identifizierung und L√∂sung von Problemen sowie die Plausibilit√§tspr√ºfung von Vorwerten.

Stammdatenverwaltung: Die Verwaltung der Stammdaten von Erzeugungsanlagen erfordert genaue und sorgf√§ltige Arbeit.







√úber Sie

Dieser Mitarbeiter wird sich einem kleinen Team in Berlin anschlie√üen, um unseren Energiehandel durch Datenmanagement zu unterst√ºtzen und zu st√§rken. Das Interesse an den Erneuerbaren Energien und die Liebe zum Detail werden hier der Schl√ºssel zum Erfolg sein. Als Associate Level in unserem Unternehmen eignet sich diese Rolle am besten f√ºr jemanden, der seine Karriere nach dem Abschluss seines akademischen Studiums beginnen m√∂chte.




Au√üerdem suchen wir jemanden mit folgenden Eigenschaften:

Ausbildung: Ein k√ºrzlich abgeschlossenes Ausbildung (z.B. Industriekaufmann IT System Management, etc.) oder ein Bacherlor-Abschluss ist erforderlich.
IT-Wissen: Ein sehr gutes Verst√§ndnis von IT-Systemen und -Prozessen ist unerl√§sslich, um die komplexen Datenfl√ºsse und -systeme im Energiesektor effektiv zu steuern.
Analytische F√§higkeiten: Die Freude an der Analyse und Aufkl√§rung unbekannter Zusammenh√§nge sowie eine analytische, zielorientierte und l√∂sungsorientierte Denkweise sind entscheidend.
Unabh√§ngigkeit und Initiative: Die F√§higkeit, selbstst√§ndig zu arbeiten und Initiative zu zeigen, ist entscheidend f√ºr den Erfolg in dieser Rolle.
Branchenerfahrung: Einige Erfahrung im Energiesektor ist w√ºnschenswert, um die spezifischen Herausforderungen und Anforderungen der Branche zu verstehen. Dies ist jedoch nicht unbedingt zu ber√ºcksichtigen.
Sprachkenntnisse: Mindestens C1 Niveau in Deutsch sowie B1 oder B2 Niveau in Englisch.




Sie erf√ºllen nicht jede Anforderung? Studien haben gezeigt, dass Frauen und Einzelpersonen aus Minderheiten oft z√∂gern, sich um Stellen zu bewerben, wenn sie nicht alle Anforderungen erf√ºllen. Wir setzen uns daf√ºr ein, einen inklusiven und authentischen Arbeitsplatz f√ºr alle zu schaffen. Wenn Sie diese Position reizt, aber Ihre Qualifikationen oder Erfahrungen nicht perfekt mit der Stellenbeschreibung √ºbereinstimmen, empfehlen wir Ihnen dennoch, sich zu bewerben. Sie k√∂nnten der ideale Kandidat f√ºr diese Position sein oder vielleicht eine weitere Gelegenheit in unserem expandierenden Gesch√§ft.







Was wir bieten

Wettbewerbsf√§hige Verg√ºtung und Beteiligung an Trailstones Ermessenszulage.
Die M√∂glichkeit, ein neues Gesch√§ftsfeld mitzugestalten und so selbst zu wachsen.
25 Tage j√§hrlicher Urlaubsanspruch.
Ein soziales Arbeitsumfeld in neuen B√ºror√§umen mit einer offenen Kultur.
Flache Hierarchien und eine No-Ego-Kultur f√ºr direkte Entscheidungsprozesse ohne B√ºrokratie.
Berechtigung f√ºr externe und interne Schulungen gem√§√ü unserer Learning & Development Policy.
Anspruch auf einen j√§hrlichen Arbeitgeberbeitrag zu Ihrer privaten Rente.







Hier bei Trailstone...

Wir wissen, wie wichtig Vielfalt f√ºr unseren Erfolg ist. Wir bem√ºhen uns aktiv, unsere Organisation weiter zu diversifizieren und begr√º√üen Bewerbungen von Menschen aller Herkunft, Nationalit√§t, Ethnie, Geschlecht, Alter, Religion, Behinderung und sexueller Orientierung sowie Veteranen und Einzelpersonen aus anderen unterrepr√§sentierten Gruppen.

Wir verstehen, dass es bei Vielfalt nicht nur um Repr√§sentation geht, sondern darum, eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven zusammenzubringen, um Innovationen zu f√∂rdern und bessere Entscheidungen zu treffen. Wir glauben an die Kraft der verschiedenen Perspektiven und engagieren uns f√ºr den Aufbau eines Arbeitsplatzes, an dem jeder gedeihen und zu unserem gemeinsamen Erfolg beitragen kann.

Begleiten Sie uns auf unserem Weg zu einer inklusiveren Zukunft.







√úber Trailstone

Trailstone ist ein globales Energie- und Technologieunternehmen, das an der Schnittstelle zwischen erneuerbaren und konventionellen Energien t√§tig ist. Wir handeln mit Energie auf globalen M√§rkten und bieten einen erstklassigen Service, um die inh√§rente Fluktuation der erneuerbaren Stromerzeugung kurz-, mittel- und langfristig zu bew√§ltigen. Als Energieh√§ndler kaufen und verkaufen wir Strom und Gas, das physisch √ºber die Netze geliefert wird, und wir nutzen unser physisches Marktwissen, um Finanzrohstoffe zu handeln. Als Anbieter von Managementdienstleistungen f√ºr erneuerbare Energien √ºbernehmen wir die Komplexit√§t des Managements erneuerbarer Energien in verschiedenen L√§ndern, damit sich unsere Kunden auf ihre Kernmission von Investitionen und Wachstum konzentrieren k√∂nnen.
