Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge that gives you the chance to use your knowledge and passion for Data Analysis to take Customer Insights at Selfridges to the next level? Looking for a company that wants to help further your career as well as provide you with an exciting, inspiring, and fun place to work?

If the answer to all of these questions is ‚Äòyes‚Äô then you‚Äôre just the kind of person we‚Äôre looking for!

Selfridges has a brilliant opportunity within the Customer Analytics Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Analytics Manager. As a Customer Data Analyst, you will have the exciting and rare chance to work in a fast-paced environment, to help us take our business to the next level

THE ROLE

As a Customer Analyst, some of your main responsibilities will be:

Provide weekly and monthly reports on key customer KPIs understand the drivers of their performance
Providing actionable insights of the back of analysis completed on customer and transactional data, using SQL.
Work with fellow analysts to create accessible, relevant, and actionable reports and Power BI dashboards, using multiple sources of data.
Own projects end-to-end and manage the process.
Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

SQL knowledges and experience building Power BI or Salesforce Einstein Analytics dashboards ‚Äì Already experience using Power BI is a bonus
Proven experience dealing with large, complex datasets of different varieties (e.g. digital data, transactional data, marketing data) and evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables and aggregation of data
Time management skills: Ability to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.
Passionate about the customer - you are passionate about improving the customer experience through delivering actionable insight
Impeccable attention to detail
A passion for solving new problems, learning new skills and furthering your understanding along the way.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The GBS Analytics team partners with an array of cross-functional departments to provide bespoke analytics solutions to their needs, both internally and externally facing. Your work will play a guiding role in shaping decision-making around advertising strategy iteration and how we communicate this with our clients.

Role Overview
- This position will have a day-to-day focus on providing analytical and strategic guidance to TikTok's Ads Business with the primary objective of enabling Sales teams to make effective and data driven decisions
- The insight and analytics produced by this role will be shared with Sales and Product leadership to shape decision making and Advertiser Marketing Strategies on TikTok
- The role will interact and work with multiple cross-functional partners including GBS, Product, Marketing Science, Research & Insights and Strategy Teams
- This is an individual contributor position with high value impact to our business.

Responsibilities
- Conduct analysis using internal and external data (e.g. Customer, Revenue, Product, Market and Industry) to derive insights that will drive business decisions
- Develop deep understanding of TikToks Ads business, analysing business and product trends (incl. regional, channel and vertical performance), synthesise and communicate insights in a comprehensible way
- Identify opportunities throughout the marketing funnel to improve Advertiser acquisition, growth and retention opportunities and present recommendations to key decision makers
- Work effectively with cross-functional teams, driving results through extracting actionable insights and building strategic partnerships with key stakeholders
- Conceptualise, build, manage and maintain tools (incl. dashboards) that GBS teams can use to extract data and insights for daily business management in an automated manner

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Experience analysing and deriving meaning from unstructured datasets
- Experience using both qualitative analysis (e.g. Hypothesis testing) and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g. Descriptive analysis)
- Experience in database interrogation and analysis tools, such as Apache Hadoop, SQL and SAS
- Experience in Data Visualisation tools, such as Power BI or Tableau
- Demonstrated problem solving experience with experience driving and delivering action based on data-driven insights and recommendations from data analyses
- Experience with digital advertising or ads monetisation

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience in a tech or scaling business environment
- Experience in a professional sales environment

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: ¬£30k-¬£60k ‚Äì London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.




All candidates must have the full right to work in the UK!




Responsibilities:

Collect and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner




Requirements:

Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
Advanced Excel skills
Power BI
Python (Desirable)
Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities




Benefits:

Competitive bonus scheme




If the above role is of interest and you‚Äôve got the required experience, apply with your most up to date CV for immediate consideration and interview!




Alternatively, if you would like to find out more about the position, reach out to me on 020 3920 8833 or at ethan.chesterfield@intechnologygroup.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - ¬£30k-¬£45 (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK‚Äôs leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketing Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on campaign performance; supporting the marketing and CRM teams to run experiments to improve UX and monetization, and building analytics to support the leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:


Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Skills We'd Love You To Have


You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills


Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Someone joins ClearScore every 20 seconds. We have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders in the U.K., and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.

Since October 2016 we have helped 1.8 million users take out a new credit card or loan. We are user-centric at our core and we believe in leveraging technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data-driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.

Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and we believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.

If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.

Benefits:


25 paid holidays and a ‚Äúduvet day‚Äù on your birthday
Hybrid Work Environment: flexible work-life balance allowing you to thrive both in the office and from the comfort of your own space.
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular well-being events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives
Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan


Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Here at Gousto, we are on a mission to become the UK's most loved way to eat dinner, and for every meal to leave the planet better off. Gousto is changing how people shop, cook and eat food at home. It‚Äôs an incredibly exciting time to join our team - and we‚Äôre a friendly bunch!

We‚Äôre proud to be one of the fastest-growing companies in the UK. Powered by data and a love of food, we‚Äôre a recipe box company that‚Äôs disrupting the sector, and we‚Äôre passionate about our diverse team and our customers.

All of our people are responsible for the success of Gousto, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating an inclusive environment for all to thrive. Our guiding values - Dream, Deliver and Care - show our commitment to innovation, our ambition to hit goals at speed, and our deep respect for the people we work with.

Job Description

Data has been at the heart of Gousto from the start!

We are investing further in our marketing, having reliable data and deep insight is critical to our success. Our on-site tagging is essential for capturing data to feed into our marketing platforms for ongoing optimisation and channel performance management. We have identified a need to have dedicated ownership of our tagging management to improve data quality, as well as further support on optimising marketing channel performance. This is where you come in.

Analysts are embedded in cross-functional tribes to ensure data-driven decision making continues to pave the way for success at Gousto. This helps you to work closely with your stakeholders to provide actionable insight on performance and future opportunities.

This is a new role at Gousto, based at our HQ in London and reporting to the Senior Analytics Manager for our Activate tribe. This is an individual contributor role.

To be successful in this role, you will be motivated by having a passion for solving complex problems, working closely with stakeholders and championing data-driven decision making. You will build a strong understanding of our tagging and marketing platforms and develop tracking solutions end-to-end.

You will be the expert in marketing tracking and the voice advocating for this area within the wider Gousto Data community, as well as contributing to knowledge sharing and improving ways of working across the Data team.

Core Responsibilities

You will split your time between tagging management and analysis - we expect a roughly equal split over time, with an initial greater focus on tracking in the first 3-6 months.


Tagging management
Take ownership of our marketing tagging, developing solutions and processes to ensure data quality and coverage
Implementation of Marketing tags, pixels through Google Tag Manager, developing the end-to-end solution
Improve our current setup as well as providing ongoing maintenance
Set up appropriate processes to minimise data quality issues
Contribute to the optimisation of our overall data curation architecture (GTM, Snowplow).
Engage stakeholders across Marketing and Data to ensure tagging meets business requirements
Keep up to date with industry best practices and bring these into Gousto
Analysis
Provide insights to the Acquisition team on opportunities to optimise marketing channel performance (e.g LTV, attribution, incrementality) and on-site signup conversion
Ad hoc investigation of anomalies and trends
Creating dashboards to help scale our understanding of acquisition
Support the Acquisition team to self serve and be data driven



Qualifications

Who You Are:


Previous experience working with paid performance and acquisition teams to analyse performance, with a focus on LTV, attribution, incrementality and on-site conversion
Solid understanding of the full spectrum of Digital Analytics, from tagging and tracking to creating reports and uncovering insights
Expertise in tag management systems, preferably Google Tag Manager
Proficiency in web design languages such as Javascript
Proficiency in analysing and visualising data using web analytics tools. GA4 experience is desirable
Demonstrated ability to deliver accurate and insightful analysis, contributing to commercial and marketing objectives
Prior experience of consent management, knowledge of GDPR legislation and strategies to handle data measurement loss in a cookieless context
Self starter with excellent project management skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, works well with diverse stakeholders and communicates effectively, even with non-technical colleagues

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.




About The Role




As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager




You will:

You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible




About You




The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience




You will also;

Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data




About Us




Harrods is one of the world‚Äôs leading luxury department stores and we‚Äôre becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world‚Äôs most inspiring shopping experiences.




Our Promise to You




Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we‚Äôll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.




In return, you‚Äôll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days‚Äô holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.




Uniquely You




At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.




If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.




Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.

HTML:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.


About The Role


As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager


You will:

  • You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
  • Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
  • Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
  • Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible


About You


The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience


You will also;

  • Previous Stakeholder management skills
  • Experience using customer or consumer data
  • Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Passion for utilising data


About Us


Harrods is one of the world‚Äôs leading luxury department stores and we‚Äôre becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the world‚Äôs most inspiring shopping experiences.


Our Promise to You


Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and we‚Äôll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.


In return, you‚Äôll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 days‚Äô holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.


Uniquely You


At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.


If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.


Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to ¬£70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business that‚Äôs fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Title: Graduate Investment Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for 2024 graduates to join one of the most interesting and exciting investment managers in their London office for summer 2024. This is an amazing opportunity to kickstart your career in an organisation which has an inclusive culture where the contributions of all our people are recognised and valued.




At the heart of the firm's mission is the responsibility to safeguard and grow investors' capital. In alignment with investor expectations, they are dedicated to cultivating a culture that upholds the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion, alongside delivering financial returns




The Data Analytics and Business Solutions team is tasked with the capture, validation, manipulation and analysis of various investment-related datasets in order to deliver effective insights, reports, completion of targeted cross-functional projects to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk, implementation of solutions to business process challenges and provision of insights to assist with decision making. As such, candidates will gain broad exposure to various functions, teams and senior personnel including those within Investment Management, Operations, Valuation, Risk, Technology and Client Services/Reporting.




Key Responsibilities:




Management of investment attribution data.
Management of pricing feeds and validation
Development of processes to improve efficiency and reduce operational risk.
Ensuring data requirements of internal and external stakeholders (incl. recurring reports) are completed
Management of cash data and reconciliation for cash forecasting exercises.
Projection of future returns for each investment within the companies portfolios on a monthly basis.
Execution of portfolio analytics and the utilization of in-house aggregation tools to generate analytical reports.
Communication of monthly portfolio projection results to senior management and clients through monthly newsletters and bespoke reports.
Address ad-hoc portfolio-related analytical requests from investors and senior management.
Collaboration with the internal tech team in targeted cross-functional projects, offering exposure to different teams and enhancing business efficiency.




Requirements:




Drive and passion to build a career in investment management
Strong numerical degree from a reputable university.
Good IT skills, especially in Excel
Some experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and C# is beneficial but not mandatory.
Ability to work efficiently under pressure, delivering accurate results within strict deadlines.
Strong team mindset and excellent collaboration skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: ¬£30,000 - ¬£35,000




Join a pioneering London-based Financial Services company that is transforming the insurance landscape with innovative solutions. With a remarkable access to funding secured in the last 6 months, this Series-A funded company is poised for exponential growth and is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team.




Role Overview:

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting complex data to help shape the future of financial technology. Your insights will drive key business decisions and contribute to the development of cutting-edge investment products. This position offers the flexibility of working fully remotely while being part of an exciting and fast-paced environment.




Qualifications:

- Bachelor's or Master's from a russell group university, and a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

- Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL




Benefits:

- Performance-based bonus

- Private health and dental insurance

- Stock options

- Opportunity to work in a fully-remote position

- Be part of a fast-growing company with significant funding and growth potential




How to Apply:

If you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst looking to make a significant impact in the Financial Services industry, we would love to hear from you. Please click apply for immediate consideration

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
London, UK

Octopus Electroverse (eMobility) ‚ö° ‚Äì Data /

Full-time /

Hybrid



About Octopus Electroverse

We‚Äôre making electric vehicle ownership as smart and as simple as possible, by building the giant, virtual charging platform of the future.

In just over 3 years, Octopus Electroverse has grown to become one of the largest eMobility players in Europe, with over 750,000 connected electric vehicle chargers and a customer ecosystem spanning web, iOS, Android, CarPlay, Android Auto & Automotive OS, and more.

But it‚Äôs just the start: we‚Äôre busy expanding internationally, working with more automotive and tech partners, building exciting new features at scale, and creating the integrated charging experiences of the future - all in the name of making public EV charging super simple for customers.

Electroverse is a multifunctional team made up of product, development, commercial, operations, marketing, partnerships and more - all focused together on making Octopus the go-to name in EV charging. And we‚Äôre looking for smart individuals with an interest in the space who can help us make it happen.

We're looking for a Data Analyst to join the Data Team within Electroverse.

This role offers a chance to contribute to the data solutions that will drive the electrification of transport. The role involves working with diverse datasets, from charge point locations and usage to marketing campaigns, sales, and operations data.

The ideal person will be passionate about leveraging data to provide insights and improve efficiency across various teams. You‚Äôll need to be great at listening, understanding challenges and formulating pragmatic solutions.

This is a fantastic opportunity to help build out a small but growing team within the business; create processes and automation pipelines and help shape the framework for how the business will handle data going forward.

What You'll Do...


Develop Data and Automation Tools: Create tools to enhance the reliability and efficiency of the Electroverse product and processes.
Maintain Data Tools: Build, maintain, and support data tools, including managing the dbt codebase, building BI dashboards, and developing data.
Data Product Development: Develop new data products to offer key insights to external customers.
Conduct Analyses and Reconciliations: Perform one-off analyses and reconciliations using SQL, Python, and Jupyter notebooks.
Support Non-Technical Teams: Assist internal teams in accessing and utilising data more effectively, building tools for a non-technical audience and potentially providing technical coaching and training.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with colleagues from Partnerships, Marketing, Operations, Engineering, and Finance within Electroverse and the broader Octopus Energy Group.



What You'll Have...


Data Modelling Experience: Proficiency in using dbt (ideally) for data modelling
Dashboard and Data Product Development: Experience in creating data dashboards and developing data products.
Collaborative Projects: Experience working on collaborative projects with business teams and familiarity with agile or similar methodologies.
Autonomous Problem-Solving: Ability to work independently, scope problems, and deliver pragmatic solutions.
Data Lifecycle Expertise: Versatility in handling the entire data lifecycle, from ingestion to visualisation and presentation.
Tool Building: Passion for creating robust and usable tools to enhance team efficiency.
Data Analysis Skills: Proficiency in SQL, python, pandas/numpy, Databricks/Jupyter Notebooks, and experience with large datasets in production environments.
Curiosity and Drive: Self-motivated with a strong desire to learn and improve.
Time Management: Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Passion for Net Zero: You don‚Äôt need to be deeply familiar with the EV market and products (we can teach that), but a passion for the transition to net zero is an excellent start



What We Work With...


dbt for data modelling
Databricks Delta Lake for data lake and warehouse storage and querying
Python as our main programming language
Jupyter and Jupyter Hub for notebook analytics and collaboration
Circle CI for continuous deployment
AWS cloud infrastructure
Kubernetes for data services and task orchestration
Google Analytics, Amplitude and Firebase for client applications event processing
Airflow for job scheduling and tracking
Parquet and Delta file formats on S3 for data lake storage
Streamlit for data applications



We would prefer someone who can work in our London office 1/2 times a week and you will also need to have full working rights for the UK as we are unable to sponsor.

If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Are you ready for a career with us? We want to ensure you have all the tools and environment you need to unleash your potential. Need any specific accommodations? Whether you require specific accommodations or have a unique preference, let us know, and we'll do what we can to customise your interview process for comfort and maximum magic!

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

Title: Data Analyst, Benefits - London
HTML:
Responsibilities

 About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
Performance & Incentives (P&I) are powerful tools for furthering the company's strategic goals. A robust P&I strategy influences the organization's ability to attract and retain the best talent, while creating a strong alignment of individuals' interests with the organization's strategic goals. The P&I Team at ByteDance, therefore, are constantly benchmarking and striving for the best practice & return on investment in developing competitive C&B policies. The P&I Team works on a lot of interesting problems. Whether it is developing new world-class compensation policies, diving deep into market research, analyzing big data and benchmarking. The P&I Team work on a lot of cool and exciting projects to come up with the best ways to serve our organization. Given the nature of our work, it also creates huge opportunities for collaboration with departments in and outside of the HR organization.

Parts of this role will require providing support across ByteDance, as well as TikTok. ByteDance is TikTok's parent company, whose mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life.

What You Will Do:
- Contribute towards the ongoing rollout of ByteDance's global benefits strategy, and improve outcomes for 27 countries in EMEA through building and optimising the team's decision-making processes;
- Leading and executing local and regional benefits projects end-to-end using analytical methods including, but not limited to, data mining, industry research, user research, etc;
- Identify, define and help to prioritise benefits projects to empower the team to reach goals effectively;
- Manage critical benefits vendor relationships and building performance tracking systems;
- Developing strategic partnerships and negotiate commercial terms.

Qualifications

 Minimium Qualifications
- Experienced in people/human resource analysis, or business/data analysis;
- Fluency in English;
- Proven in report writing skills, be able to do proposals based on research and analysis, which are presentable to stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications
- Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in a human resource, business or data analytics capacity;
- Knowledge and experience in SQL, Python or SPSS is an advantage;
- Self-motivation and curiosity, fast-learning to discover the relationship between data and human resources policies;
- Strong communication skills in English;
- Experienced working in fast-paced environment, preferably in a tech firm.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Graduate Insight Analyst
Description:
Introduction

In this role, you will be working in our B2C function working primarily in the acquisition insights team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team of supportive and highly collaborative insights specialists, data scientists and engineers.

You will work across a multitude of projects ranging from supporting monthly reporting, working with senior analysts to deliver insights projects and help analyse test results. You will be part of a team who delivers tangible difference and whose work impacts day to day decision making at The Economist.

We are looking for a candidate who is curious, looking to learn new skills and with an aptitude for insight. Experience working with analytics data or other large data sets using SQL or other languages is advantageous but not essential and candidates looking to develop their technical skills are also welcomed.

Accountabilities


Working closely with senior analysts and other members of the team to deliver insights work to product and marketing stakeholders.
Supporting the team across a variety of different tasks ranging from reporting, to deep dive insights projects and testing.
Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts.
Become an expert in how The Economist acquires new subscribers and how we can optimise our channels and platforms.
Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities.


Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes


Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
Experience working with datasets
Some familiarity with analytics systems
A proactive approach to problem solving


The following would also be advantageous but not required:


Experience using SQL for data analysis
Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business

  • Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts.
  • Become an expert in how The Economist acquires new subscribers and how we can optimise our channels and platforms.
  • Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities.

Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes

  • Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
  • Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
  • Experience working with datasets
  • Some familiarity with analytics systems
  • A proactive approach to problem solving

The following would also be advantageous but not required:

  • Experience using SQL for data analysis
  • Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Rapp

We stand up for individuality. We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency‚Äôs vision. And most importantly we value every individual‚Äôs wellbeing.

As a diversity champion, equal opportunities and disability confident employer and an ardent advocate of flexible working we understand that everyone has unique requirements and needs.

We are a global creative agency, but the individual really is at the heart of everything we do. We use data to find out what makes them tick. We use technology to talk to them one-to-one ‚Äì but to one million at a time. And we use creativity to encourage them to engage, click, buy and bond, again and again.

Each brand is unique and has its own individual challenges. We pride ourselves in rising to each and every one of them, for brands such as KFC, Mercedes Benz, IKEA, Paypal and Virgin Media 02.

Us

In order to foster collaboration and relationships, our hybrid model requires three office days per week. As equal opportunities proponents, we are open to discuss any hybrid working related needs during the initial screening.

Learning and Development is important. We all know that. Its why we have a dedicated Learning and Development team and offer regular career conversations and bespoke L&D programmes so that you can leave us with more than when you started.

We recognise that the work of diversity, equity and inclusion calls on all of us. That‚Äôs why we set up The Neighbourhood. A collective of people, at different stages of the DE&I journey, whether impacted or allies, dedicated to helping our colleagues take ownership and effect change across 4 key pillars; Anti-racism, Disability, Gender & LGBTQ+ and Parents & Carers.

The Health and Wellbeing of our people matters immensely. We offer Coaching opportunities for all through our partnerships with Sanctus (mental health partner who provides online coaching; you can talk about anything, personal or professional) and Sayge (1:1 professional development coaching program). We have 40 trained Mental Health First Aiders across the agency and have Babylon Health (Private GP service) for all.

You‚Äôre better at work when you feel better in yourself. So, in addition to your annual holiday, you can take a ‚ÄúMe‚Äù day and an ‚ÄúUs‚Äù day, every year. Your ‚ÄúMe‚Äù day is for you to invest in yourself ‚Äì go after a life goal, meditate, learn to paint, bake cakes or just have a duvet day watching Netflix!

Your ‚ÄúUs‚Äù day is all about giving back and helping others ‚Äì volunteer, pick litter at a local park, hang out with the elderly or raise money for a local charity.

We‚Äôre progressive and always open to new initiatives, for example we‚Äôve recently partnered with Fertifa (Leading Fertility and Reproductive Health benefit providers). Because we know the journey to becoming a family isn‚Äôt always easy (that includes men too), and we support our people through that journey whether you are new parent, experiencing the menopause, or anything else in between.

Whatever stage of life you are at, we make sure you have the tools you need to have a healthy work life balance.

US MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

Your Role

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilising your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you‚Äôll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won‚Äôt be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management


You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed


Client


Understanding clients‚Äô objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
Build relationships with analysts client side
Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
Communicate analytical outputs
Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery

New Business / PR


Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry


Network


Understand our network and other players within it


Evolution


Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly


Your Skills And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master‚Äôs degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
1 ‚Äì 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
Statistics
Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
Value engineering / Business casing
Performance Measurement and Measurement Frameworks
Data Protection / GDPR
Customer journey analysis and planning
Brief planning and writing
Progressive data capture
Segmentation and Modelling
Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.


Recruitment process

We‚Äôre not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

We are RAPP. And we can‚Äôt wait to meet you

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
ESG Data Analyst - Data Science - Investment Management - up to ¬£110,000




Our client, a leading Investment Management organisation based in the City of London, are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to join them on a permanent basis. You will be joining the ESG Data team and assist in the development of a Data Science model.




The successful candidate will be responsible for progressing the automation of ESG data production, analysis and systematic integration with other systems currently being utilised by the business. Alongside this, you will be enhancing ESG data through improving data quality and transparency as well as devising innovative approaches for ESG data analytics and insights through building robust data orientated solutions in Python.




The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset and demonstrate strong problem solving skills. You will also have experience working within Investment Management or a similarly regulated industry.




Key Skills:

3-7 years experience working as an ESG Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of Python and building data orientated solutions for businesses.
Knowledge of ESG metrics is highly beneficial.
Experience working with modern data tools (e.g. Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas etc.)
Exposure to machine learning approaches such as neural networks and generative AI is desirable
Experienced working in the Investment Management industry

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - ¬£45-55k - London/Hybrid




This digital production house that specialise in gaming are looking for their first in-house Data Analyst to join the business. They work with tech companies to provide data-driven insights and analytics that enhance player experiences and optimise game performance.




What will you be doing?




Collaborate daily with developers to apply and test analytics libraries.
Present metrics and analyses to guide smart game development decisions.
Use SQL, R, and Tableau to answer customer questions and dive deep into data.
Work with partner analytics teams at a top tech company.
Monitor key metrics like user retention and content update impact.
Build dashboards to visualise metrics and analytics.
Report on issues, analytics results and quality status.
Leverage game feature knowledge and player behavior insights for improvements.




Skills needed:




SQL experience & understanding of relational databases
Experience with a data visualisation tools like Tableau, Microstrategy, or Power BI
Games industry experience - supporting game development/release/live ops
Passion for gaming
Ideally some game development experience - typescript proficiency or C++ etc.
Strong communication skills & collaborative mindset




If you are passionate about gaming and have the necessary skills and experience, I'd love to hear from you!




Apply now and I'll be in touch to arrange an initial call to talk through the details.




Please note that all applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Keyrus Group is a trusted leader in Data Intelligence with 27 years‚Äô worth of experience, over 3,200 consultants and offices across the globe in 26 countries. Our expert teams provide strategic data engineering, data analytics, and data science solutions for our clients, primarily in the financial services, utilities and energy industries.

The Keyrus UK team is expanding rapidly. Our team has doubled in the last 12 months and is continuing to grow! If you are looking to join an innovative company that has the support of an internationally recognised brand, we encourage you to apply.

The Opportunity

Keyrus is a key player in consulting and technology specialized in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation with clients in more than 20 countries on 4 continents.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in utilizing Alation and Experian platforms to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, extracting valuable insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business decisions.

Responsibilities


Utilize Alation and Experian platforms to gather, organize, and analyze large volumes of data.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical results.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and support special projects as required.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics, Alation, and Experian technologies.


What We're Looking For In Our Applicants


Proven experience working as a Data Analyst with specific experience using Alation and Experian platforms.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and techniques.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with data governance and metadata management is a plus.


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

You will be part of a young and ever learning enterprise with an established international network of thought leading professionals driven by bridging the gap between innovation and business. You get the opportunity to meet specialised and professional consultants in a multicultural ecosystem.

Keyrus gives you the opportunity to showcase your talents and potential, to build up experience through working with our clients, with the opportunity to grow depending on your capabilities and affinities, in a great working and dynamic atmosphere.

Keyrus UK Benefits


Competitive holiday allowance
Very comprehensive Private Medical Plan
Flexible working patterns
Workplace Pension Scheme
Sodexo Lifestyle Benefits
Discretionary Bonus Scheme
Referral Bonus Scheme
Training & Development via KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:

Develop and implement quantitative models.
Analyse large datasets to identify patterns and opportunities.
Collaborate with the research team to improve algorithmic performance.
Conduct back testing of algorithms to validate their effectiveness.
Optimize existing algorithms for better performance and lower latency.
Communicate findings and insights to the team through detailed reports.




Requirements




Education:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science.




Experience:

Experience in developing and implementing quantitative models.
Strong background in statistical analysis and probability theory.
Proficiency in Python (experience with libraries such as NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.).




Skills:

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work with large datasets and perform complex data analysis.
Excellent communication skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Qualifications:

A Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in one of the related fields.
Familiarity with other programming languages such as C++, R, or MATLAB.
Experience with machine learning techniques and frameworks.
Familiarity with data processing tools and environments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly

Exciting opportunity to join a multi-award winning digital agency. Play a lead role optimising performance marketing and campaign analytics.

You'll be looking after multiple projects utilising your expertise in in building Tableau dashboards, delivering complex digital data insights in simple terms to senior clients and stakeholders to optimse performance of media campaigns.

This is a great opportunity to work for a business renowned for the well-being policies, flexible working and incredible social and fun working environment.

Work with the likes of Tesco, cruise.com and many more


You

Ideally experience with Python, Bigquery or cloud technologies
Experience with media or digital data and/or agency background would be a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üåü Data Insight Analyst at top Lloyd's market Insurerüåü




Excellent Salary + Bonus + 31 days holiday + Excellent Benefits

Hybrid working: London Office (2/3 days a week in the office)




Are you passionate about data analysis, visualization, and driving business insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment? Look no further! Our Lloyds Market Insurer customer is seeking a talented and creative Data Insights Analyst to work directly with teams across the business to deliver the information they need.




This is an organization at the forefront of cutting-edge data services, capturing, transforming, and analyzing diverse data through their modern cloud-based platform, generating invaluable insights for their business. Now needing a Data Analyst to take this to the next level!




As the successful Data Insights Analyst you will need:




Essential skills:

Power BI report development (including DAX).
Transact SQL and Python/Scala scripting.
Stakeholder management and requirements capture.
General analytical and modeling techniques.
Data visualization and dashboard design.




Desirable:

Understanding of Lloyd‚Äôs Insurance market data.
Experience with Agile processes.
Data quality management expertise.
Familiarity with modern data processing technologies (data lakes, warehouses, reporting tools).
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure data and analytics tools (including Azure Databricks).




Role Highlights:

Hands-On Impact: Dive into data, collaborating directly with cross-functional teams to deliver critical information.
Analytical Skills: Design repeatable reports and create ad-hoc analyses to drive data-driven decisions.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with business teams, bringing their ideas back to the data team.
Continuous Learning: Explore new skills and innovative ways to analyze and visualize data.




Responsibilities:

Understand data requirements from colleagues across the business
Prioritize work within the Data Insights team.
Contribute to Agile project delivery.
Develop reporting and visualization solutions.
Collaborate on data engineering and architecture requirements.
Uphold data standards and governance.
Coach colleagues in data analysis self-service.
Monitor data quality and raise awareness of best practices.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and your application will be reviewed swiftly.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Strategy (12 month FTC)
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Strategy Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and the Product Strategy Manager in providing data-driven insights to support strategic decision making. This role will focus on strategic planning and insights, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, executive dashboard reporting as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys the fast paced environment of a growing company, has experience in product analytics and has a passion to contribute to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have a background in data science or advanced product analytics at either a dating, social, gaming or other relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical product and business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of data and use that knowledge to partner with product, strategy and exec level leaders, naturally connecting product, revenue, and broader customer data sources, taking a holistic approach to find answers. You are able to leverage your data modelling and advanced analytics skills to help senior leadership navigate ambiguity and shape analytical roadmaps, projects and insights. You can translate complex analytical findings and business metrics into clear, concise recommendations for product managers, executives, and other stakeholders.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Remaining laser-focused on the "so what" of the findings, and how the insights support business decisions you take an integrated perspective to analytics, considers all the potential drivers to a problem, reviewing existing knowledge and bringing in expertise for advice from other teams.

You enjoy efficiently producing insights that inform decision-making and are passionate about continual improvement, both personally and for the team around you. You always look for feedback to strive for higher quality of deliverables.

Key Accountabilities


Develop and deliver analytical roadmaps to support long-term product strategy, including executive dashboard reporting, deep-dive analysis, and performance measurement of product changes
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will act as a trusted thought partner as the analytical authority in your domain. You will likely be dedicated to a set of specific initiatives and projects, where you will be expected to act as a representative of the R&A team, demonstrating our values, capabilities, and competencies.
You will develop a deep knowledge on the product domain, becoming the authority on its characteristics, drivers and sub systems. You will proactively educate stakeholder functions to further democratise this understanding.
You will contribute to data quality as it relates to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will build and manage self-serve data products, a knowledge base of insights, and provide direct support, to empower others to fully understand the value of data in their day-to-day work.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience in data science, statistical analysis, solving complex analytical problems and modelling data that aims to answer a big picture question regarding the business‚Äô long term strategy and direction.
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
You have experience in roadmapping and outlining product strategy that influences senior stakeholders.
Preferred experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience with data modelling, advanced analytics and data engineering needed to automate insights, reporting and measurement.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in commercial analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator.
A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset, machine learning and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.


About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.
