Over 5,000 employees worldwide are collaborating from kitchen tables, home offices, coworking spaces, and Zendesk workspaces to make one team.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, & storytellers. Our mission is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. As the developer of The Sims , we create games and experiences for millions of people around the world and are always looking for new ways to inspire our players. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don't settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be.

As a Data Analyst - Live Service on The Sims‚Ñ¢ 4, you will partner with product, design, production, and engineering leads to rapidly evolve and modernize the gaming experience through swift iterations. You will report to the Manager, Analytics.

From engagement analysis, to monetization measurement, A/B testing and insights delivery, you will be the go-to resource for understanding how our live service is doing, where it is headed, and will have a significant influence on the world‚Äôs leading life simulation game.

Your colleagues will be a tight-knit studio of enthusiastic industry craftspeople. You‚Äôll also join a network of hundreds of experienced analysts and data scientists at EA as a member of the embedded-and-dedicated Data and Analytics (DnA) team.

The Sims‚Ñ¢ 4 has an extremely unique player base, attracting a large, young, female-skewing audience. If you‚Äôre passionate about games and excited about contributing to the best possible experience for our players through data and insights, come join us!

Main Responsibilities


Live Service Analysis: Inform rapid iterations to keep our live service fresh and engaging. Benchmark and measure the impact of live events and free content updates. Develop insightful data visualizations using Looker to inform strategy. Present compelling data stories.
A/B Testing and Experiment Design: Design, analyze, and optimize A/B tests for features, events, and promotions, explaining results clearly and concisely.
Telemetry Design: Collaborate with the game development team to understand features and design telemetry for tracking key moments, ensuring accurate data collection for continuous improvement.


Requirements


1+ years of experience working as a data analyst on a digital product in a professional setting;
Experienced proficiency querying large datasets with SQL;
Experience with live service analysis with examples of impact;
Statistical knowledge including an understanding of probability, correlation, regression, and classification;
Data storytelling skills, including ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical people;
Experience with A/B and multivariate test analysis;
A passion for Games;


Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


¬∫ $73,200 - $101,700 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Analyst

Job Title: Data Analyst

Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you will be integral in developing and implementing quality control plans for projects to ensure they meet established standards and customer requirements. Your role will involve optimizing processes, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and using data analytics to enhance project performance. You will be responsible for developing tools, maintaining a centralized data repository, and using statistical analysis to identify and address quality issues. Additionally, you will develop training materials, provide training, and communicate insights and recommendations directly to customers.

Hard Skills


Power BI
Excel
Data Visualization
Statistical Analysis
Quality Control
Industrial or Manufacturing Experience


Soft Skills


Process Improvement
Cross-functional Collaboration
Communication
Proactive Metrics Development
Training & Development

Title: Data Analyst (Street Operations)
Description:
Requisition ID: 41733

Organization

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the x ∑m…ôŒ∏k ∑…ôyÃì…ôm (Musqueam), S·∏µwxÃ±w√∫7mesh (Squamish), and s…ôlilw…ôta…¨ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world‚Äôs most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, reconciliation, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose and Function

This position is responsible for providing technical oversight of Street Operations data collection for street and sidewalk infrastructure maintenance and repair programs and ensuring that data is maintained in accordance with best practices. This position performs highly complex data analysis using large data sets and produces visualization, reports and summaries related to expenditures, schedules and accomplishments, using modern business intelligence (BI) tools.

The Data Specialist supports asset maintenance and repair programs for streets, sidewalks, and structures in accordance with best practices including: analysis of large data sets related to pavement, sidewalks and structures, analysis of capital, operating, repair and maintenance costs for various asset types, and review of asset management data sets to inform maintenance and repair programs.

Specific Duties And Responsibilities


Manages the ongoing operation and maintenance of data and related data infrastructure to meet the data analytics and reporting needs of the Streets Operations Branch.
Leads, consults, and participates in business process and technology reviews of all Street Operations functions recommending solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
Leads the development of Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting platform for Street Operations.
Designs and implements sustainable and repeatable data management approaches involving cloud, on-premise, and big data datasets and technologies.
Develops and maintains large data sets pertaining to spending, cut repairs, work accomplishments, 311 citizen complaints, equipment, etc. from multiple City of Vancouver sources including but not limited to SAP, Hansen and SEAM.
Designs and develops reports, visualizations, and dashboards for tracking KPIs, metrics and service levels using advanced Excel, GIS Software, and modern BI tools for presentation at the branch, divisional, and department level, as well as to external stakeholders.
Recommends solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
Identifies implications and makes recommendations for changes in data processes and procedures that may affect operational areas.
Collects and analyzes data to complete current state analyses and to optimize solutions.
Processes data sets for quality assurance and following up for corrective action where required.
Builds financial models that accurately project the annual cost recovery rates required to balance expenses such as equipment and fleet.
Collaborates with broad, multi-functional project teams to maintain clarity of objectives and alignment on implementation plans.
Manage data requests from internal and external stakeholders including other Engineering Services branches, 311, Risk Management, Freedom of Information, and Legal Services.
Teaches, mentors and supports administrative staff in the application of best practice approaches to data input and administration to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Directs and reviews the data collection work of manual data collection efforts.
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.


Qualifications

Education and Experience:


Completion of a post-secondary degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Business Administration, Business Analytics or related field of study plus considerable experience in data analysis, business process and/or performance improvement in a public sector or large multi stakeholder organization or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Strong knowledge of Microsoft Power BI, Dataflows, Power BI Service and paginated reports.
Sound knowledge of structured operational business processes.
Working knowledge of could and on-premise warehouses and query systems.
Advanced in the use of Microsoft Excel and office suite with excellent keyboarding skills
Analytical skills, accuracy and attention to detail with a strong sense of accountability.
Skilled in the use of data systems and statistical data collection.
Excellent business writing skills.
Ability to analyze and synthesize data from multiple data sources and formats.
Ability to work with query languages (SQL, MDX, etc.)
Ability to design and build data warehouses and data marts.
Ability to problem solve and provide creative ways to resolve issues.
Ability to communicate effectively, foster high standards, and deliver results in a fast-paced, performance focussed environment.
Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities and respond to requests in a timely manner.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts and team members to provide advice, information, and mentoring.
Ability to demonstrate an organized and local approach to finding solutions to complex situations or problems.


Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)

Affiliation: CUPE 15 Non Pks

Employment Type: Regular Full Time

Position Start Date: August, 2024

Salary Information: Pay Grade GR-024: $42.04 to $49.65 per hour

Application Close: July 7, 2024

At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous peoples, people of colour, 2SLGBTQ+ persons including all genders and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Before you click Apply now

Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date.

In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx. 5-10 minutes. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a summary of skills and experience related to the position.

Title: Geoscience Data Analyst
Description:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.

We are looking to add an GeoScience Data Analyst to our GeoScience team. The role will report to the Team Lead, GeoScience and be based out of the Vancouver office. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in detailed data analysis and statistics within the mining industry. You will work with clients globally, to incorporate MineSense solutions into their ore control processes and show them the value of using our systems. If you enjoy working with data, collaborating with multidisciplinary groups, and have a mining, geology, or geophysics background, we want to hear from you!

Job Responsibilities:


Helping new and existing clients leverage MineSense technology in their grade control engineering processes, which includes developing client facing reports and presentations.
Collaborating with internal teams to develop prediction models by correlating mine grade measurements or estimates with our sensor results to identify patterns, trends or other data features that relate to grade, texture, mineralogy, or lithology.
Working with the Field Service and Product Development team to further enhance our products and services through system data analysis and data quality assurance/control.
Determining and tracking data model accuracy and precision through comparison with sampled assay grades or grade estimates.
Reporting and presenting data results/trends to internal teams, as well as external clients.
Working closely with the Data team to create queries, scripts, and reports while ensuring data is well organized and maintained.
Building and maintaining good working relationships with our clients.
Promotes a positive company culture through sharing of information and supporting the learning and development of all colleagues.
Additional duties as occasionally required by your manager.


Qualifications:


Degree in Earth Sciences (Geology, Geophysics), Geo statistics, Data Analytics, Mining Engineering or related field.
0-4 years of relevant professional working experience, where experience in mining is preferred.
Experience performing statistical analysis or data science in a work setting is preferred.
Mining experience with in-grade control or working with ore control models is preferred.
Experience with data analysis tools such as python or other statistical packages.
Experience with SQL is preferred.
Experience and passion for solving analytical problems involving diverse data sets using quantitative approaches to generate insights.
Attention to detail and an interest in problem solving.
Oral and written proficiency in English is required.
Additional oral and written proficiency in Spanish is required.
The ability to travel and support global offices is required (10-30%).
Legally able to work in Canada.


$91,000 - $110,000 a year

The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are in growth mode and are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.

Our total rewards package includes:


A competitive bonus.
Matching RRSP or 401K program (for Canadian and US employees)
A comprehensive benefit program
Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)
Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)
3 weeks' vacation or more depending on the position
Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team


Here's what you can expect as a part of the MineSense Team:

When you join MineSense, a trailblazing Canadian mining technology company, you become a part of our purpose to maximize global metals and minimize global impacts. We‚Äôre not just a company; we‚Äôre a Community of Innovators who forge a path toward a sustainable future. Here‚Äôs why we want you to be excited:


Purpose-Driven: At MineSense, we don‚Äôt just clock in‚Äîwe live our purpose. We‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize the mining industry, and every day, we‚Äôre one step closer to a cleaner, greener world.
Values That Resonate: Our core values‚ÄîInnovation, Belonging, Resilience, and Adding Value‚Äîaren‚Äôt just buzzwords. They‚Äôre the bedrock of our culture. When you step into our team, you‚Äôre not just an employee; you‚Äôre a steward of these values.
Impactful Work: Imagine contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable planet. At MineSense, you‚Äôre shaping the future of cleantech and developing cutting edge technology that literally hasn't been developed before. Your work matters, and it echoes beyond our walls.
People-Centric: We‚Äôre not just about profits; we‚Äôre about people. Our organization cares deeply about its employees. When you join us, you become part of a community that supports growth, well-being, and success.


Ready to make your mark? Join MineSense and be part of something bigger than yourself.

MineSense is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment or hiring process, please contact us at careers@minesense.com for assistance. Information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

All applications are welcome, even if you don't meet all the requirements, so please do not hesitate to apply.
Show more
HTML:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.

We are looking to add an GeoScience Data Analyst to our GeoScience team. The role will report to the Team Lead, GeoScience and be based out of the Vancouver office. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in detailed data analysis and statistics within the mining industry. You will work with clients globally, to incorporate MineSense solutions into their ore control processes and show them the value of using our systems. If you enjoy working with data, collaborating with multidisciplinary groups, and have a mining, geology, or geophysics background, we want to hear from you!

Job Responsibilities:

  • Helping new and existing clients leverage MineSense technology in their grade control engineering processes, which includes developing client facing reports and presentations.
  • Collaborating with internal teams to develop prediction models by correlating mine grade measurements or estimates with our sensor results to identify patterns, trends or other data features that relate to grade, texture, mineralogy, or lithology.
  • Working with the Field Service and Product Development team to further enhance our products and services through system data analysis and data quality assurance/control.
  • Determining and tracking data model accuracy and precision through comparison with sampled assay grades or grade estimates.
  • Reporting and presenting data results/trends to internal teams, as well as external clients.
  • Working closely with the Data team to create queries, scripts, and reports while ensuring data is well organized and maintained.
  • Building and maintaining good working relationships with our clients.
  • Promotes a positive company culture through sharing of information and supporting the learning and development of all colleagues.
  • Additional duties as occasionally required by your manager.

Qualifications:

  • Degree in Earth Sciences (Geology, Geophysics), Geo statistics, Data Analytics, Mining Engineering or related field.
  • 0-4 years of relevant professional working experience, where experience in mining is preferred.
  • Experience performing statistical analysis or data science in a work setting is preferred.
  • Mining experience with in-grade control or working with ore control models is preferred.
  • Experience with data analysis tools such as python or other statistical packages.
  • Experience with SQL is preferred.
  • Experience and passion for solving analytical problems involving diverse data sets using quantitative approaches to generate insights.
  • Attention to detail and an interest in problem solving.
  • Oral and written proficiency in English is required.
  • Additional oral and written proficiency in Spanish is required.
  • The ability to travel and support global offices is required (10-30%).
  • Legally able to work in Canada.

$91,000 - $110,000 a year

The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are in growth mode and are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.

Our total rewards package includes:

  • A competitive bonus.
  • Matching RRSP or 401K program (for Canadian and US employees)
  • A comprehensive benefit program
  • Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)
  • Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)
  • 3 weeks' vacation or more depending on the position
  • Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team

When you join MineSense, a trailblazing Canadian mining technology company, you become a part of our purpose to maximize global metals and minimize global impacts. Title: Senior Data Analyst (Remote!)
Description:
About Super.com

We started Super.com to help maximize lives‚Äìboth the lives of our customers and the lives of our employees‚Äì so that everyone can experience all that life has to offer. For our employees, our promise is that Super.com is more than just a job; it‚Äôs an opportunity to unlock one‚Äôs potential, where learning is celebrated and impact is realized.

We are more than a fast-paced, high-growth tech company; we care about our people and take career progression seriously. This is your career and our aim is to supercharge it through the people, the work, and the programs that fuel who we are.

About This Team

As a Senior Data Analyst you will be reporting into a centralized Analytics & Data Science team designed to foster the data driven culture at Super.com. The multi-disciplinary team supports our travel vertical which specializes in hotel inventory distribution to end users. Our team operates at the intersection of data-driven decision-making and novel product development. We are dedicated to rapidly experimenting. The team is responsible for developing performant pricing strategies, optimizing acquisition channels, and evaluating marketing strategies aimed at attracting high-intent, quality users.

About This Role

We are seeking a skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Travel vertical. This new team member will work with travel-related data, such as: hotel inventory availability, price competitiveness, and customer journey flows within our mobile application and on our website. You will use data to confidently answer strategic questions and uncover insights about paid and organic traffic that will drive our business strategy and rapid growth. A major component of this role is data quality investigations, whereby you will query granular data to understand if our tracking plans are functioning as intended, particularly surrounding our native reinforcement learning pricing model.

A significant aspect of your role will be to uphold the integrity and accuracy of our data. You willl conduct detailed investigations using that data by querying information in its most granular state to verify the effectiveness of our tracking and analytics systems and recommend improvements. With your strong analytical skills in both SQL and Python, you will excel in quantitative analysis and confidently be able to translate your findings to business stakeholders.

This position offers a dynamic and impactful opportunity to assume ownership of your work as you conduct in-depth analyses to implement, debug, QA, and refine our data processes. You will work closely with our Travel leadership team to answer some of the company‚Äôs most urgent and impactful questions, and be exposed to rich data about the travel industry.

Responsibilites


Data-driven Culture: As an ambassador for our data-driven culture, you will leverage complex datasets to generate actionable insights that influence product strategy and drive results
Investigate Trends & Anomalies: With a keen eye for detail, you will investigate and analyze trends and anomalies in our pricing model data. This includes supporting debugging efforts and drilling down into data to uncover the root causes of changes in conversion rates and top-line financial metrics.
Data Management: you will access, clean and organize raw data in a way that makes sense for you, your team and your stakeholders
Business Understanding: you will determine the why behind our data-driven insights, and how the data both explains and impacts our business decisions. This includes analyzing how our various pricing strategies affect different customer segments and types of hotel properties. You will also be using these insights to formulate strategic recommendations



Preferred Experience


Advanced level proficiency in SQL and Python for data analytics
Experience with 1 or more dashboarding tools and comfortability with Git
Mentorship experience with a keen interest in teaching and peer reviewing work from other team members
3+ years of Experience working with data (as an Analyst, Scientist, or similar)
Strong technical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze and model a high volume of relational and potentially unstructured data
Experience working in a fast paced, high growth startup environment or the travel industry
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of presenting data and insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences



Bonus Points


Proficiency with tools such as DBT, Amplitude, Snowflake and Looker
Ability to independently collaborate with business stakeholders and create data models designed to address specific questions and uncover valuable business insights
Bachelors in STEM and an advanced degree in Analytics, Data Science or equivalent



We've got you covered!


Competitive salary packages, equity options, great benefits from day one, wellness budgets, as well as personal and team-level development budgets
We are remote first ‚Äì you have the flexibility to work from around the world and the hours that make sense for you‚Äì so that you can do your best work while living life on your own terms
Other perks include: unlimited PTO, recharge days, travel discounts on SuperTravel, Weekly UberEats credit and much more!
We welcome new family additions with generous parental leave and a flexible return-to-work plan
This is just scratching the surface‚Äì see our careers site for a more detailed overview of our perks & benefits



We Believe in Equal Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If needed, please notify our Talent Acquisition Partner.

As part of our compensation philosophy at Super.com we benchmark roles based on geographic location. The base salary range for this position is $70,000 CDN - $140,000 CDN

  • We welcome new family additions with generous parental leave and a flexible return-to-work plan

We Believe in Equal Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If needed, please notify our Talent Acquisition Partner.

As part of our compensation philosophy at Super.com we benchmark roles based on geographic location. The base salary range for this position is $70,000 CDN - $140,000 CDN

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
What's Bench? Visit Bench's latest news to see what's happening, and read what our customers have to say. You can also check us out in Medium, on our LinkedIn page, our Instagram, and our Life at Bench Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench is founded on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x ∑m…ôŒ∏kw…ôyÃì…ôm (Musqueam), Skwxw√∫7mesh (Squamish), and S…ôlÃì√≠lw…ôta î/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.

Our mission is to help every business owner thrive, by providing financial insight and peace of mind in one seamless platform. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.

We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!

About the Team

The Data Insights Group at Bench comprises two teams: Data Analytics and Analytics Engineering. This group is a centralized function responsible for delivering data products, providing decision-making support and insights, and maintaining analytics pipelines and data warehousing for all of Bench. The Data Analytics team works closely with business leaders and Strategy & Operations managers to develop instrumentation for core metrics and leverage findings to generate strategies to grow the business.

What you'll be getting up to:


Being a deeply trusted partner, leader and advisor to business teams
Having a strong understanding of our business metrics and how they relate to our business teams, while providing an informed opinion in strategic decision making
Ensuring that the definitions of metrics are consistent across our current and new reporting
Creating business cases and roadmaps in partnership with stakeholders and project managers that improve the state of the data ecosystem
Building and maintaining sources of truth that support "self-serve" analytics
Transforming data through SQL queries to blend meaningful insights from various data sources and data warehouses
Delivering ad-hoc analysis, recommendations and insights that stakeholders can action
Identifying, tackling and reconciling reporting issues in a timely manner
Highlighting opportunities to accelerate our business performance and strategy
Identifying opportunities to upstream teams to improve data and systems architecture
Assessing gaps in existing metrics layers and providing feedback to analytics engineering and system teams to develop solutions upstream

To be successful in this role, you'll need to have:


3+ years of experience in accounting, finance, consulting, strategy, business intelligence or a related field
Degree in Business, Economics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields
Experience translating complex business problems into clear drivers and structured models
Excellent skills in BI tools like Tableau, SQL, Google Sheets, etc.
Exceptional analytical skills and intuition
Comfort working with quantitative and qualitative data
Experience communicating recommendations effectively to senior leadership
Ability to adapt to shifting priorities with high resilience and strong problem-solving skills


You're a great fit if you have:


A nose for value: You can take a big-picture perspective to identify and stay focused on what's most important
Appreciation for systems: You can connect the dots and figure out the best solution for Bench, not just the stakeholders you're working with
Intellectual curiosity: It's not enough for you to know the what - you want to know the why. You are energized by challenging problems, and are persistent/ resourceful in your efforts to solve them
Startup hustle: You are highly motivated, proactive, comfortable with change and ambiguity. You have a humble, team-player attitude and are ready to pitch in wherever you are needed most


What you'll get:


At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $73,200 - $91,500 per year, depending on experience.
In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, paid flex days, stock options, and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get access to Inkblot Therapy's Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP) that offers counseling and support, for you and family members, as well as professional development coaching, financial advice, legal advice and much more.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
If you live in BC's Lower Mainland, you have the opportunity to work at home and in our downtown office location, depending on your preference! For some roles, we do require folks to be in the office regularly. We'll be sure to outline expectations during the interview process.
For folks working fully remote, we will provide additional solutions to bring teams together for collaboration and connection.
Whether you get to use the office or if you work remotely, you'll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.
You'll have the opportunity to work from somewhere other than your home province for up to 3 months, within a 12 month period.


Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society‚Äîincluding but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. If you are selected for an interview and require support during the process, including disability accommodation, we'll give you the opportunity to tell us when we contact you.

Title: Support Analyst
Description:
Support Analyst (Data Analyst)




At Inkeros we are committed to delivering seamless and efficient IT support services to ensure the smooth and error-free operation of our stakeholders' applications, systems, and data. The purpose of the Support Analyst role within our IT Support department is to serve as a frontline troubleshooter and solution provider, dedicated to resolving internal support tickets promptly and enhancing our technological solutions to meet evolving needs.




EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND DELIVERABLES

Serve as a Level 1 within Inkeros‚Äô Support Escalation Program:

Diagnose and resolve support tickets by reproducing each reported issue and tracing issue to locate root cause
Log and report outcomes, actions taken, and resolutions
Evaluate and respond to support issues to ensure stakholder‚Äôs needs are met while maintaining a high degree of user satisfaction
When required, escalate the support issue to Level 2 (IT Support Leads / Managers)

Provide accurate work estimations and ensure projects are completed according to schedule:

Regularly communicate with manager and teammates about progress towards milestones

Use Jira tickets to coordinate ongoing development initiatives and daily tasks:

Monitor Jira tickets on a daily basis to ensure assigned tickets are up to date and responded to appropriately
Ensure tickets maintain a high level of communication, and teammates and stakeholders are kept appropriately informed

Maintain and extend Inkeros‚Äô in-house solutions:

Perform regular maintenance tasks
Progress tickets through regular development path
Write QA testing instructions
Participate in scrums daily or as assigned

Create and modify new features:

Develop and Implement new features from written specifications
Document implementation (what was implemented and how it works)
Modify existing features to adhere to changing requirements
Attend project technical briefings




REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:

Continuous Learning: Actively seeks opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge to improve personal and organizational performance.
Informing: Effectively communicates essential information to team members, ensuring clarity and timeliness regarding tasks, deadlines, and deliverables.
Teamwork: Collaborates with colleagues across teams to achieve common objectives and goals.
Adaptability: Easily adjusts to changing work environments and requirements, demonstrating flexibility in approach and mindset.
Follow-through: Demonstrates self-direction and accountability, ensuring tasks are completed and projects are seen through to the end.




TECHNICAL SKILLS

Mandatory Skills:

Knowledge on GCP or AWS or Azure, Familiarity with GCP services such as Compute Engine, CloudRun, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, and others or similar Cloud services.
Database Fundamentals with SQL: Proficient in writing SQL queries for data manipulation and retrieval.
Python
Bi Tools (at least one) : Tableau,Power BI
Working knowledge of NOSQL ,RDBMS

Nice to have:

Docker (Docker Desktop, Docker Compose)
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Familiarity with GCP services such as Compute Engine, CloudRun, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, and others.
Programming Languages:
JavaScript: Competent in frontend and backend JavaScript development.
HTML/CSS: Proficient in building and styling web pages using HTML and CSS.
Version Control: Git: Experience with version control systems, particularly Git, for managing codebase changes.
Operating Systems: Windows 11 with WSL (Ubuntu): Experience in working with Windows 11 alongside Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) for development purposes.




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Previous IT Support Experience
Programming and Scripting Experience
Required to pursue and stay up to date with training modules, courses, and certifications if/when prescribed by Inkeros, including GCP certifications.




PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT:

Opportunity to increase scope and responsibilities to the senior level is possible with good performance and as the team grows over the years
The skills acquired through high performance in this role may prepare one for other technical roles including Lead/Senior Support Analyst, Software Development Engineer, Systems Engineering & Cloud Administrator

Show more
HTML:
Support Analyst (Data Analyst)


At Inkeros we are committed to delivering seamless and efficient IT support services to ensure the smooth and error-free operation of our stakeholders' applications, systems, and data. The purpose of the Support Analyst role within our IT Support department is to serve as a frontline troubleshooter and solution provider, dedicated to resolving internal support tickets promptly and enhancing our technological solutions to meet evolving needs.


EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND DELIVERABLES

Serve as a Level 1 within Inkeros‚Äô Support Escalation Program:

  • Diagnose and resolve support tickets by reproducing each reported issue and tracing issue to locate root cause
  • Log and report outcomes, actions taken, and resolutions
  • Evaluate and respond to support issues to ensure stakholder‚Äôs needs are met while maintaining a high degree of user satisfaction
  • When required, escalate the support issue to Level 2 (IT Support Leads / Managers)

Provide accurate work estimations and ensure projects are completed according to schedule:

  • Regularly communicate with manager and teammates about progress towards milestones

Use Jira tickets to coordinate ongoing development initiatives and daily tasks:

  • Monitor Jira tickets on a daily basis to ensure assigned tickets are up to date and responded to appropriately
  • Ensure tickets maintain a high level of communication, and teammates and stakeholders are kept appropriately informed

Maintain and extend Inkeros‚Äô in-house solutions:

  • Perform regular maintenance tasks
  • Progress tickets through regular development path
  • Write QA testing instructions
  • Participate in scrums daily or as assigned

Create and modify new features:

  • Develop and Implement new features from written specifications
  • Document implementation (what was implemented and how it works)
  • Modify existing features to adhere to changing requirements
  • Attend project technical briefings


REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:

  • Continuous Learning: Actively seeks opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge to improve personal and organizational performance.
  • Informing: Effectively communicates essential information to team members, ensuring clarity and timeliness regarding tasks, deadlines, and deliverables.
  • Teamwork: Collaborates with colleagues across teams to achieve common objectives and goals.
  • Adaptability: Easily adjusts to changing work environments and requirements, demonstrating flexibility in approach and mindset.
  • Follow-through: Demonstrates self-direction and accountability, ensuring tasks are completed and projects are seen through to the end.


TECHNICAL SKILLS

Mandatory Skills:

  • Knowledge on GCP or AWS or Azure, Familiarity with GCP services such as Compute Engine, CloudRun, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, and others or similar Cloud services.
  • Database Fundamentals with SQL: Proficient in writing SQL queries for data manipulation and retrieval.
  • Python
  • Bi Tools (at least one) : Tableau,Power BI
  • Working knowledge of NOSQL ,RDBMS

Nice to have:

  • Docker (Docker Desktop, Docker Compose)
  • Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Familiarity with GCP services such as Compute Engine, CloudRun, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, and others.
  • Programming Languages:
  • JavaScript: Competent in frontend and backend JavaScript development.
  • HTML/CSS: Proficient in building and styling web pages using HTML and CSS.
  • Version Control: Git: Experience with version control systems, particularly Git, for managing codebase changes.
  • Operating Systems: Windows 11 with WSL (Ubuntu): Experience in working with Windows 11 alongside Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) for development purposes.


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Previous IT Support Experience
  • Programming and Scripting Experience
  • Required to pursue and stay up to date with training modules, courses, and certifications if/when prescribed by Inkeros, including GCP certifications.


PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT:

  • Opportunity to increase scope and responsibilities to the senior level is possible with good performance and as the team grows over the years
  • The skills acquired through high performance in this role may prepare one for other technical roles including Lead/Senior Support Analyst, Software Development Engineer, Systems Engineering & Cloud Administrator

Title: Data Analyst (12 month mat leave contract)
Description:
This position entails the thorough examination and oversight of data coming from the Recycle BC program. The emphasis lies in upholding data integrity and effectively conveying analytical findings to both internal and external stakeholders.

This is a 12 month mat leave contract coverage with possibility of renewal on a 6 month contract interval.

Key Responsibilities:


Review all incoming data prior to submission to CM/Recycle BC.
Assist in the maintenance and updating of databases to ensure data quality and accuracy.
Address data entry errors/discrepancies promptly and verify data on a daily basis.
Conduct reconciliations between internal and external databases to identify and rectify variances.
Assist with or take ownership of other analysis and reporting tasks as needed.
Communicate analysis outputs internally and with company partners.


Knowledge, Skills and Competencies:


Undergraduate degree in statistics, data science, mathematics, or other quantitative discipline.
Two years or more of data analysis experience, preferably within the waste sector.
Great communication and presentation skills, both written and oral.
Proficiency in database management, with a proven ability to import, export, and format data from diverse sources.
Proficient in statistics and analysis tools, with a preference for Python packages.
Experience with visualization tools like Power BI.
Independent worker with strong collaboration and critical thinking skills.
Maintain focus in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating multitasking abilities.
Strong attention to detail.

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst (Rainstar Capital Group)
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Entry Level Data Analyst to join our data team. This role will support various aspects of our data analysis initiatives, including data cleaning, statistical analysis, and report generation. The ideal candidate will have a strong aptitude for problem-solving and a keen interest in utilizing data to drive business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Clean and organize raw data from various sources.
Perform preliminary analysis and visualizations using tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python.
Assist in creating and maintaining automated data processes.
Collaborate with senior analysts and team members to understand data needs and requirements.
Generate reports and presentations for stakeholders based on analysis results.
Identify patterns and trends in data sets to inform business strategy.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through thorough testing and validation.


Required Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in Excel and/or statistical software (e.g., R, Python, SAS).
Basic knowledge of databases and SQL.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Eagerness to learn and develop new skills in data analysis and visualization.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and algorithms.
Previous internship or coursework related to data analysis.
Understanding of business operations and key performance indicators (KPIs).


Benefits


Competitive salary based on qualifications and experience.
Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
Dynamic and inclusive work environment that values innovation and teamwork.


Application Process: Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your interest in the role and relevant qualifications to [contact email or application link]. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Value

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).

We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.

We work hybrid at Plenty of Fish - IRL in our downtown Vancouver office on Tuesday and Wednesday and work remotely the remainder of the week!

We are looking for someone to be a part of our Product Analytics team, who will work cross-functionally with the rest of the organization to help identify, understand, and improve business and product challenges facing Plenty of Fish. The Senior Product Analyst will deliver high-quality strategic and tactical analysis; collaborating with the product, engineering, data science, business intelligence, customer service, and marketing teams.

So, what will you do?


Provide a variety of stakeholders from Executives, Product Managers, Engineering Managers, or other Data Analysts, with deep-dive quantitative analyses and present them in an immediately usable format, extracting key insights from extensive, complex data sets
Proactively find opportunities to take analytics framework to the next level and lead stakeholders to adopt new frameworks and methodologies
Quantitatively analyze user behaviour to help determine product strategy and drive business decisions, including driving decisions from A/B test learnings
Take ownership of ambiguous and complex analytical assignments



You'll be a match for this role if you have..


5+ years of progressive experience using quantitative analysis to make business-focused recommendations
Strong understanding of incrementally as well as sizing business problems and opportunities
Proven technical data analytics skills in working with large amounts of data at different levels of aggregation, from raw telemetry to metric stores.
Experience with raw clickstream data (telemetry event data) and datasets of 100 million+ records
Experience with web/digital analytics metrics (Daily Active Users, Retention, Churn)
Understanding of basic statistical concepts such as confidence interval, normal distribution, correlation, linear regression, and multivariate testing
Proficiency with SQL or other query languages
Strong experience with A/B test analysis
In-depth experience with data visualization and analytical tools (E.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
A proactive skill set that encompasses problem identification, analysis, solution definition, results, and communication
Experience with Python or a willingness to learn



$116,000 - $130,000 a year

Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Vancouver, British Columbia.


We would love to hear from you, even if you don't match 100% of the requirements**



Why Plenty of Fish?


We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2023 !
Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days
RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan
Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from day one
Match Group mentorship program
Parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits
Extended health & dental benefits from day one
Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits
And many more on our careers page



Our Values


Be Proud - We own our ship. We see challenges as opportunities and take action.
Make Waves - We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.
Dive Deep - We empathize with our members and use data to surface thoughtful decisions.
Crew Together - We're all working towards the same goals and win as a team.



Want To Dive Deeper?

LinkedIn

Glassdoor

We‚Äôre committed to creating an equal and inclusive environment; we welcome all crew (and prospective crew) members regardless of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, conviction unrelated to employment, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination recognized by applicable law. Plenty of Fish is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please speak to your recruiter directly.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

On behalf of our public sector client, Affinity is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to collaborate with the Liquid Waste Services Business Strategy and Improvement Team. The role involves creating data visualizations by analyzing extensive manual datasets using SQL and Power Queries to extract and present valuable insights from different systems.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Translating business requirements into technical specifications

‚Ä¢ Data profiling

‚Ä¢ Source data analysis with SQL or applicable tools

‚Ä¢ Business Analysis

‚Ä¢ Designing and developing the data analytics (data warehouse, data lake ODS, data modeling, Power BI security, Power BI workspace) reusable framework

‚Ä¢ Designing data models based on technical specifications

‚Ä¢ Exploring in-depth Power BI features for advanced analytics which requires customizations like DataFlow & DataMart

‚Ä¢ Designing and building data pipelines and ETL packages including:

oM Query

oDax Language

oPower Query

oDashboards and reports with Power BI Desktop

oTroubleshoot day-to-day data warehouse issues

Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Design, build, and deploy BI solutions (e.g., reporting tools, dashboards)

‚Ä¢ Maintain and improve existing BI systems

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle).

‚Ä¢ Experience with on-premise data warehouse reusable framework design and implementation

‚Ä¢ Experience with data modeling, analysis, and visualization

‚Ä¢ Work with relational and non-relational databases to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data

‚Ä¢ Experience with building data pipelines and ETL processes

‚Ä¢ Extensive development experience with technologies including SQL Server, REST API, OLAP cubes, BI analytic tools

‚Ä¢ Extensive analytic development experience with Power BI and preferably Microsoft Power Platform.

‚Ä¢ Advanced Power BI Service configurations such as Power BI DataFlow and DataMart

‚Ä¢ Experience in Power BI report development, reports automation with data source refresh configurations

‚Ä¢ Experience with analyzing data source systems to identify data transformation needs

‚Ä¢ Thorough knowledge of software development methods, practices and procedures

‚Ä¢ Ability to prepare technical design and write technical specifications

‚Ä¢ Experience using Azure DevOps to manage projects is preferred

‚Ä¢ Experience with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus

In Addition, this position requires the ability to:

‚Ä¢ Establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal contacts

‚Ä¢ Provide advice and assistance on matters related to the work

‚Ä¢ Ability to document, analyze, and assess a variety of information, identify priorities and resources, and propose alternative business processes

‚Ä¢ Ability to assist in the development of standards and to perform other administrative tasks related to the work performed

‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing and to present proposals in non-technical language

‚Ä¢ Perform assigned duties with minimal supervision, although direction will be given.

‚Ä¢ Maintain confidentiality

hourly rate: $75 per hour.

Affinity Earn:

Know someone who‚Äôs great for this, or any of our open roles? Earn up to $4,000/year for each successful referral through Affinity Earn. You can also earn up to $50,000 for helping us find new clients. Learn about our referral program at https://affinity-group.ca/earn/ or browse our jobs & follow us at https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-staffing/jobs/

About Affinity:

Affinity Group is a full-service Information Technology services and staffing company. We believe recruiting is about creating long-term relationships that foster a mutually beneficial partnership - an affinity. Bringing a new style of recruiting founded on five core principles: Transparency ‚Äì Flexibility ‚Äì Efficiency ‚Äì Agility ‚Äì Inclusivity.

We teamed up with ClimatePartner in 2022 to offset our emissions and move toward being a more environmentally friendly company and we are proud to be officially now Carbon Neutral Certified.

For more information on Affinity, please visit www.affinity-group.ca

Job Number: 10785

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Clio is more than just a tech company‚Äìwe are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

We are currently looking for a new Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team in one of our Vancouver, Calgary, or Toronto locations.

What your team does:

Our Business Intelligence team is part of the larger Data & AI group. Together, we‚Äôre focused on stewarding a scientific culture to drive better decisions. Along with the Manager of Business Intelligence, you will be working across departments to empower all stakeholders to make better decisions through data-oriented solutions, with a focus on making data easy and accessible at Clio. You will help our business grow, help our customers succeed, and continuously improve the way we operate.

Who you are:

We aren‚Äôt looking for just any traditional Business Intelligence Analyst to join this team. We‚Äôre looking for someone who takes data seriously, thrives in a rapid-growth, high-velocity environment, and someone who lives and breathes their values. We‚Äôre looking for an innovator and a thought leader! We‚Äôre looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate about driving growth empirically;
  • Always looking to innovate with data and explore open-ended questions;
  • Strategically minded and never shies away from a challenge;
  • Self-motivated and able to work autonomously and collaboratively;
  • Agile and responsive, and comfortable with constant change.

What you‚Äôll work on:

  • Partnering with stakeholders, self-serve report creators, the data scientists and data engineers, and others to create meaningful, intentional data solutions;
  • Standardizing source of truth dashboards and applying best practices to create dashboards that convey the most important metrics for the business;
  • Creating and editing data models for users to answer business questions and optimize queries and reports for performance;
  • Effectively communicating findings and feedback to technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to govern our BI environment to empower our self serve stakeholders leveraging data and dashboards;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to proactively identify and resolve gaps in training, learning resources, and other roadblocks preventing stakeholders from leveraging data for decision making.

What you may have:

  • An undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant quantitative discipline (computing science, statistics, mathematics, etc.);
  • 3+ years applied experience in business intelligence and/or data modeling;
  • Proficiency in database modeling, SQL, and knowledge of data warehousing principles;
  • Proficiency with data visualization and data storytelling;
  • An understanding or familiarity of SaaS business metrics such as MRR, churn etc;
  • A passion for understanding data and to figure out the root cause of a metric trending below target;
  • Proven experience with one or several cloud based business intelligence tools, incl. Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Serious bonus points if you:

  • Have experience working with Redshift or other cloud data warehouses;
  • Are an expert translating technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders;

What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio‚Äôs Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:

  • Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
  • Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office min. once per week on our Anchor Day.
  • Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
  • $2000 annual counseling benefit
  • RRSP matching and RESP contribution
  • Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years

The expected salary range* for this role is $78,400 to $106,100 CAD. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

  • Our salary bands are designed to reflect the range of skills and experience needed for the position and to allow room for growth at Clio. For experienced individuals, we typically hire at or around the midpoint of the band. The top portion of the salary band is reserved for employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. Those who are new to the role may join below the midpoint and develop their skills over time. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on geographical region, applicable experience, and skillset of the candidate.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì BTO
Description:
JOIN US IN CHARTING A COURSE TO A MORE SUSTAINABLE FUTURE




Join an organization that plays a critical role in Canada‚Äôs economy. At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we focus on doing the incredible work it takes to become the world‚Äôs most sustainable port.




The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is responsible for the stewardship of the Port of Vancouver, Canada‚Äôs largest and most diversified port. Our mandate as a Canada Port Authority, as set out by the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada‚Äôs trade objectives, ensuring goods are moved safely and responsibly through the Port of Vancouver. That means providing infrastructure and ensuring the safe and efficient movement of marine traffic and cargo within the port. It also means we carry out reviews of proposed activities and developments on federal port lands and waters to determine whether a project can go ahead without impacts to the environment and community that cannot be mitigated.




We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability. We believe in creating a workplace that reflects the richness of our community and empowers all employees to reach their full potential.

The business intelligence analyst ‚Äì BTO develops and implements visualizations and dashboards that provide actionable insights to the business. This role uses a blend of creative and technical skills to develop intuitive BI solutions that meet the needs of our users.




What You Do

Collaborate with business units to gather requirements, objectives, and KPIs, understand their reporting, data, and product needs, and identify data dependencies and relationships
Create appropriate datasets, data flows in Microsoft data platform based on the defined information architecture
Design and develop and deploy user-friendly, visually appealing BI dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Build and narrate data stories and guide in building PowerPoint decks
Provide technical expertise regarding the unique features and constraints of Power BI and related technologies, including best practice recommendations
Develop documentation, user guides, and training materials to support user adoption and customer service. Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of workflows, addressing user-reported issues
Catalogue, develop and maintain operational reporting, dashboards and scorecards that track organization key metrics




What You Bring

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, management information systems, or other relevant discipline
Minimum three (3) years of experience working with BI tools or any data-specific role, plus demonstrated experience of database management, data modeling, business intelligence, SQL querying, data warehousing, and online analytical processing (OLAP)
Expertise in tools and systems on MS SQL Server BI Stack, including SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, Power BI, and DAX is required
Experience in configuration of Microsoft Dynamics and Power Platforms is an asset
Experience in configuring, customizing, and extending Dynamics 365 CRM to meet business needs, including workflows, forms, entities, and plugins is an asset
Strong ability to discern trends and patterns from large amounts of raw data
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills with the ability to take a thoughtful data driven approach to addressing workforce challenges
Must be able to deal with ambiguity and create processes and structure where it does not currently exist
Ability to maintain utmost confidentiality and work with restricted confidential data
Ability to quickly shape data in reporting and analytics solutions and perform testing to assure report and dashboard accuracy




What We Offer

We offer a robust total rewards package including:

Market-competitive base salaries and variable incentive plan
Generous and inclusive benefits offering including retirement benefits plan
Earned time off program
Paid vacation and personal care leave
Learning, development, and advancement opportunities
Onsite gym with towel service in a national landmark in the heart of Vancouver‚Äôs waterfront
Friendly, unique, and respectful workplace




Location: Vancouver, Canada




Job type: Bargaining Unit, Full-Time, Permanent, Hybrid




Working environment: Normal office conditions. Flexibility to respond to issues during non-working hours as required.




Marine Transportation Security Clearance

This position is required to access restricted areas/information. The incumbent must obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance as defined by the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.




This is Canadian-based employment, and it is expected that all employees maintain legal entitlement to work in Canada. Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be subject to background checks, including but not limited to criminal record, credit, and/or reference checks.




At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous peoples, and members of visible minorities. Reasonable accommodation can be provided in the selection process and while working with the port authority. If you require support applying to our openings, please contact us at careers@portvancouver.com.

Title: Data Analyst, Alumni Engagement Services
Description:
Position Job Title: Data Analyst, Alumni Engagement Services

Location: Vancouver (hybrid)

Reports To: Associate Director, Alumni Engagement Services




Primary Purpose




The Data Analyst, Alumni Engagement Services (AES) is a key member of the AES, overseeing and implementing data management practices to ensure effective use of constituent data. As an experienced data management professional, the analyst collaborates with team members engaging various constituents through events, volunteer roles, committees, boards, affinity, and lifelong learning opportunities. This supports the development and execution of meaningful alumni engagement strategies, fostering lifelong connections and advancing University Canada West's alumni relations goals.




The analyst works closely with Institutional Accountability, IT, Data and Privacy, Student Affairs and Services, and the Office of the Registrar to uphold data integrity. Responsibilities include data preparation, transformation, query writing, statistical analysis, and report preparation.




Specific Responsibilities




DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING




Configure alumni database systems and oversee data entry and updates to meet team needs.
Identify and categorize alumni according to established protocols for tracking linkages and interests.
Ensure compliance with university data collection and management policies.
Accountable for working with sensitive information and ability to maintain strict confidentiality.
Design monthly statistical reports and dashboards to monitor key performance indicators.
Manage alumni data imports/exports, conduct accuracy audits, and advise management.
Provide statistical data for engagement activity development, conducting quantitative and qualitative research, analysis, and interpretation of alumni and constituent data.
Conduct database analysis and assess needs, recommending technologies to support institutional research, predictive analysis, and meaningful alumni engagement.
Utilize statistical software for data analysis and stays updated on best practices in alumni data management.
Develop protocols to safeguard alumni data and provide recommendations for approval.




RESEARCH




Provide analytical and research support for alumni initiatives, leveraging existing relationships to engage alumni and respond to their interests.
Contribute to planning and implementing reports, data requests, and research. Proactively identify opportunities and manage projects to support data-informed decision-making, advancing university goals for increased alumni engagement.
Independently develop methodologies and evaluation criteria based on recent trends in alumni relations and data management.
Review literature in alumni relations, identify research opportunities, and share best practices with the alumni team and campus partners.




ALUMNI ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY




Utilize research and alumni data analysis to contribute to annual planning for alumni identification, cultivation, engagement, and stewardship.
Collaborate with the team to create and deploy data analysis tools for monitoring objectives, metrics, and success indicators.
Conduct surveys using institutional tools, translating results into visualizations or concise summaries.




PROGRAM AND EVENT SUPPORT




Configure database to facilitate seamless import/export of constituent participation and data capture for alumni benefits, programming, events, and communications, utilizing tools such as the alumni portal, Mailchimp, and virtual/in-person interactions.
Collaborate with the team to monitor progress of programming and events towards key performance indicators.




FUND DEVELOPMENT AND EXTERNAL RELATIONS




Configure the database to track affinity partner promotions, event/program revenue, sponsorship engagement, and other revenue sources as directed.
Conduct and manage constituent research to support team interactions with various stakeholders, including alumni, sponsors, affinity partners, campus champions, professional associations, university promotional materials, alumni recognition, and the Alumni Advisory Board.
Conduct and track constituent research to support interactions with alumni, sponsors, affinity partners, campus champions, professional associations, university promotional materials, alumni recognition, the Alumni Advisory Board, and other stakeholders.




VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT




Configure database to track alumni volunteer participation in university committees, events, panels, and external associations.
Provide reports to the team on alumni volunteer involvement to monitor progress towards key performance indicators.




MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS

Configure database to support and track alumni communications, ensuring compliance with legislation and best practices.
Manage returned email/mail, entering or distributing updates as needed.
Present research results clearly through narrative, tables, graphs, and oral presentations using institutional software.
Design data formats, reports, charts, and graphics in line with graphic design standards.
Creates concise and user-friendly research briefs for a general audience.




RELATIONSHIP BUILDING




Offer recommendations to enhance institutional awareness of impactful alumni engagement, focusing on actionable insights, high-impact activities, and best practices for advancing alumni relationships.
Collaborate with Institutional Accountability to integrate alumni engagement goals into routine campus reports, conducting research like campus-wide surveys and focus groups.
Present research findings to various campus groups, including leadership, administration, and staff from Student Affairs & Services, Academic Affairs, Faculty, and the Registrar‚Äôs Office.




COLLABORATION AND SUPERVISION




While this role has no direct reports, it oversees supervision of the University‚Äôs alumni data systems.
Design and provide training on data entry and management protocols, use of monthly statistical reports and customized dashboards that monitor progress towards key performance indicators.
Provide back-up for the operations assistant as required.




ADMINSTRATION AND FINANCE




Coordinate the import of alumni data with the Office of the Registrar into alumni data management systems as determined by annual schedule.
Send pre-approved university and external partner messages and updates alumni records.
Identify and resolve duplicate records in the database through manual deletion or merging.
Design reports and queries for mailings/invitations and assists with mail and email merges.
Identify third party sources of information to improve and enhance database; remain current with trends in database technology.
Act as the primary contact for technical support, troubleshooting issues, and recommending upgrades.
Implement and monitor the assigned operational budget in accordance with university policies and procedures, ensuring financial goals are met.
Prepare, review, and finalize reports on all data systems to support the development of annual operational budget.




Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities




Maintain a high degree of confidentiality and handles sensitive issues with tact.
Proficient in reporting tools, capable of designing custom reports, dashboards, and pivot reports.
Proactive approach to project identification, research, recommendation development, procedure creation, and implementation.
Statistical experience in the social sciences or education.
Ability to develop metrics, templates, and tools for continuous improvement tracking and monitoring of key indicators, promoting data-informed decision-making.
Willingness to learn tools and technologies to support research, data analysis, and visualization.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy.
Ability to work independently and manage projects under tight timelines.
Adaptable to shifting priorities.
Experienced in survey design.




Required Qualifications




Bachelor‚Äôs degree
Two years of professional experience in data analysis and/or visualization.
Intermediate knowledge of excel (including but not limited to VLOOKUP, pivot tables, calculations, basic visualizations, power pivot, and power query).
Basic knowledge of statistical concepts and applications.
Experience using constituent relationship management software.




Preferred Qualifications




Master‚Äôs degree.
Experience conducting applied social/educational research and/or assessment projects.
Three to five years of progressively responsible professional full-time experience in higher education or a non-profit organization.
Experience data visualization tool with additional knowledge in using scripting language like R, Python, or SQL.
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI an asset.




To apply for this role, please submit your resume and cover letter in one PDF file.




We greatly appreciate your time and efforts in applying for the position at UCW, however, please note only successful candidates will be contacted.
